PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJoseNot RecommendedQuit4Not for me after 3 hours. I love old school JRPG's but this homage to it falls short. Doesn't do much to keep you engaged when it comes to creativity nothing in this game I haven't seen. I find hard to grind for levels especially when they try to make this game harder than your typical RPG. If your going to raise the standard as far as difficulty goes then make it easy to grind. In order to grind you need to leave an area completely to respawn the baddies and then your xp gains are drastically low. After 3.5 hours I was level 4! A level is about 1000 xp but your getting 30 or 60 xp?? Doesn't make sense to me. Story is lame nothing new at all kids that are meant to save the world and poor writing.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Aug 31, 2023513Only visible to youGameoverpodcastRecommendedPlaying9After only 3 hours in, I'm hooked. It reminds me of my childhood gaming days. great turn based combat. The art style reminds me of the Mana Saga games. 

I will update my review once I beat the game. Cheers.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Aug 29, 202351Only visible to youVash4eNot RecommendedQuit4This was a tough one to review because in all honesty, it hits the right note on almost everything. Itâ€™s a fine RPG on a surface level but as you start to dig into it, it slowly starts to unearth itself as something that can be seen as shallow.

Which is a shame, because all of the individual aspects of the game feel and look really great. The pixel art has such style and it looks so well crafted that you want to be in there forever. The music hits all the right feelings that it wants to hit (special shout-out to the boss music!). And the battle mechanics have a fresh feel but also calls back to classics like Chrono Trigger and Mario RPG. It also has a simple plot that is easy to understand that also has its own twists and turns.

But the more I played this game, the more I started to feel discredited towards it. What looked like a game that was a pool full of great style and mechanics, quickly dissolved into a little rain puddle with no room for growth. Growth is the keyword here, because it doesnâ€™t feel like Iâ€™m growing as a player, the leveling up and the battle system start to stagnate real fast here, and it underlines everything that this game tries to do. The dungeons, though some are fun, are very drawn out and start to drag 2/3rds of the way through them, and without any growth in between these segments, it makes the story elements really not matter much if the growth essentially stays the same for the most part.

I can appreciate some of the side quests once you really start the game and the lively characters you can recruit, but you eventually hit a wall knowing you will go through fight after fight but doing the same thing...over and over. It feels like the freedom of growth has been taken away, or maybe Iâ€™m too used to games like Persona and Xenoblade giving me tons of freedom of role playing how I personally like to role play.

With all this said, I had to drop this game, unfortunately. And itâ€™s not something I can easily recommend to someone. There is no way to track them or find them easily later.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Sep 28, 202320Only visible to youEierpilotNot RecommendedBeat6Writing this review is challenging because Sea of Stars genuinely appeals to me with its retro RPG style. The execution, however, feels incomplete. I really enjoyed the characters and the setting in the first half of Sea of Stars. The level design and puzzles were entertaining, and the battles against monsters were also well-executed. However, in the second half, the battle system failed to evolve, resulting in long and often tedious encounters. Additionally, the story lost its initial appeal, which only added to the frustration. In conclusion, the first 15 hours of Sea of Stars offer a great RPG experience, but the second half becomes a slog.Jun 30, 202410Only visible to youIkkeMichiNot RecommendedQuit6LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Apr 30, 202410Only visible to youAlondonoNot RecommendedBeat5LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Apr 6, 202410Only visible to youGoldenGoofyNot RecommendedQuit5LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCombatMore...Apr 2, 202410Only visible to youAranothNot RecommendedBeat6Sep 5, 202311Only visible to youoscar45RecommendedPlaying10LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Jan 3, 202410Only visible to youMacFourRecommendedBeat10LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jan 2, 202410Only visible to youElements0fStyleRecommendedPlaying9This is a classic JRPG with heavy inspiration from Chrono Trigger, Super Mario RPG, and Golden Sun. PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youTheRealNayNayRecommendedBeat8My best friend recommended this game to me â€” something that they thought Iâ€™d enjoy playing, despite the underlying plot that you help souls cross into the other side to the afterlife. They were 100% correct. 

This game had beautiful artwork, and the storyline and characters were all well thought out. Each character that you meet has a unique personality, tone and goals to add into your journey. The map and general workings of the game were easy enough to understand while having some mystery on how to navigate. The perfect balance of guidance and exploration (in my opinion). 

The pace of the game was great and was something that I was able to put a lot of hours into, yet didnâ€™t feel rushed to finish. This is absolutely one of my favourite games that Iâ€™ve played in a long time. I would highly recommend to people and players who enjoy cozy gaming, exploration, narrative story lines and who can appreciate incredible gaming art styles. At the end of it, you hear many beautiful stories and lessons that you have likely learning in your real life. 


The reasons I didnâ€™t award it 10/10 was for 2 things: (one which is absolutely subjective, sorry!) 

1. The ending (no spoilers), felt abrupt because the direction you receive is a bit vague. I wish that you would have had to complete all spirits journeys, and finish any unresolved quests before you complete the game. When I finished, it had said I only completed 90% of the quests which annoyed me.

2. I did run into a few technical glitches, which Iâ€™m sure isnâ€™t an issue on other gaming platforms, this one shut down once for me, and then had a handful of lag-gy moments. I think there could be some updates for the switch to make it 100% user friendly and glitch-free.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 20, 202420Only visible to youcharlie_dudeRecommendedBeat10This game has been one of the most influential pieces in my life. user_id:
Only visible to youTheRealNayNayRecommendedBeat8My best friend recommended this game to me â€” something that they thought Iâ€™d enjoy playing, despite the underlying plot that you help souls cross into the other side to the afterlife. They were 100% correct. 

This game had beautiful artwork, and the storyline and characters were all well thought out. Each character that you meet has a unique personality, tone and goals to add into your journey. The map and general workings of the game were easy enough to understand while having some mystery on how to navigate. The perfect balance of guidance and exploration (in my opinion). 

The pace of the game was great and was something that I was able to put a lot of hours into, yet didnâ€™t feel rushed to finish. This is absolutely one of my favourite games that Iâ€™ve played in a long time. I would highly recommend to people and players who enjoy cozy gaming, exploration, narrative story lines and who can appreciate incredible gaming art styles. At the end of it, you hear many beautiful stories and lessons that you have likely learning in your real life. 


The reasons I didnâ€™t award it 10/10 was for 2 things: (one which is absolutely subjective, sorry!) 

1. The ending (no spoilers), felt abrupt because the direction you receive is a bit vague. I wish that you would have had to complete all spirits journeys, and finish any unresolved quests before you complete the game. When I finished, it had said I only completed 90% of the quests which annoyed me.

2. I did run into a few technical glitches, which Iâ€™m sure isnâ€™t an issue on other gaming platforms, this one shut down once for me, and then had a handful of lag-gy moments. I think there could be some updates for the switch to make it 100% user friendly and glitch-free.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 20, 202420

user_id:
PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youSayuri_SekaikamiNot RecommendedBeat5If you're a fan of Harry Potter world, it's worth looking into it, but if you're a gamer who loves a good story, well-written characters and interesting sidequests, brace yourself. 
Most of the efforts went into the visual stuff and design of the world so it would look believable. However, the plot, the overall scriptwriting, the dialogues, the characters, even voice acting are very mediocre and sometimes even bad. This game is full of chests but their contents are mostly rubbish. 
All in all, the character you're playing as is an avatar. A nobody. You don't have a history before Hogwarts. Noone really explains why you're so special and talented. The world won't react to your actions even if you're walking through the castle killing everyone you meet. And, if you're a Ravenclaw, you won't even get a chance to solve a riddle when you enter your house's common room. 

Among the good things, I personally loved flying on a broom and caring for the beasts. Also, the missions with Poppy Sweeting have the most beautiful level design,majestic beasts included. 
Hogwarts Legacy gives lots of things to explore. The designers and artists must have taken years to implement all the details in the castle. The battles can also be fun. Especially the final one is epic. 
I spent more than a hundred hours in this game but some things I played through in irritation or boredom. It's a one-time mediocre game for me. Won't recommend but I don't regret playing it either.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 31, 2023114Only visible to youhammerhead43RecommendedBeat8Only an 8/10 overall score, but 10/10 regarding just pure fun. So much customization. Flying on the broom is so awesome. The combat is really great also. The story was â€œmehâ€ and the side missions are too repetitive with not good enough rewards for completing them. 

But in terms of the lore and the visuals, it was an amazing experience. Any Harry Potter fan should play this game.May 30, 202330Only visible to you5nack5hackRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Jun 2, 202320Only visible to youZayroRecommendedBeat7Great gaming eith good story and visuals. I 100% the game, getting the platinum trophy on PS5.

I would recommend sticking to the story and side quests at most. Avoid the excess collectibles.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Dec 20, 202420Only visible to youKristopher CantrellRecommendedBeat9This game is exactly what the wizard community needed. The world is a faithful rendition that felt perfect. I spent hours just walking around the castle in awe, admiring the attention to detail and the raytraced drip that oozed out of every inch. The combat was done well, I think this is the most polarizing aspect of the game. I feel like every interation that I could remember from the books was addressed, except for quidditch, in the game. I hope they turn this into a series, I would love to compete in the tri-wizard tournament.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 5, 202420Only visible to youhousearcher87RecommendedBeat9Fun HP game. user_id:
Only visible to youSayuri_SekaikamiNot RecommendedBeat5If you're a fan of Harry Potter world, it's worth looking into it, but if you're a gamer who loves a good story, well-written characters and interesting sidequests, brace yourself. 
Most of the efforts went into the visual stuff and design of the world so it would look believable. However, the plot, the overall scriptwriting, the dialogues, the characters, even voice acting are very mediocre and sometimes even bad. This game is full of chests but their contents are mostly rubbish. 
All in all, the character you're playing as is an avatar. A nobody. You don't have a history before Hogwarts. Noone really explains why you're so special and talented. The world won't react to your actions even if you're walking through the castle killing everyone you meet. And, if you're a Ravenclaw, you won't even get a chance to solve a riddle when you enter your house's common room. 

Among the good things, I personally loved flying on a broom and caring for the beasts. Also, the missions with Poppy Sweeting have the most beautiful level design,majestic beasts included. 
Hogwarts Legacy gives lots of things to explore. The designers and artists must have taken years to implement all the details in the castle. The battles can also be fun. Especially the final one is epic. 
I spent more than a hundred hours in this game but some things I played through in irritation or boredom. It's a one-time mediocre game for me. Won't recommend but I don't regret playing it either.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 31, 2023114

However, the plot, the overall scriptwriting, the dialogues, the characters, even voice acting are very mediocre and sometimes even bad. This game is full of chests but their contents are mostly rubbish. 
All in all, the character you're playing as is an avatar. A nobody. You don't have a history before Hogwarts. Noone really explains why you're so special and talented. The world won't react to your actions even if you're walking through the castle killing everyone you meet. And, if you're a Ravenclaw, you won't even get a chance to solve a riddle when you enter your house's common room. 

Among the good things, I personally loved flying on a broom and caring for the beasts. Also, the missions with Poppy Sweeting have the most beautiful level design,majestic beasts included. 
Hogwarts Legacy gives lots of things to explore. The designers and artists must have taken years to implement all the details in the castle. The battles can also be fun. Especially the final one is epic. 
I spent more than a hundred hours in this game but some things I played through in irritation or boredom. It's a one-time mediocre game for me. Won't recommend but I don't regret playing it either.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 31, 2023114

user_id:
PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youSpyrouRecommendedBeat9Profound story on loss and recovery which may be interpreted differently by players. 
Simple mechanics: Nice learning curve and lots of good ideas in the puzzles.
Great art style: both graphics and sounds. 
A relaxing game, not too challenging. 
Personal warning: the themes could trigger some individuals, about sadness.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 6, 202520Only visible to youLawsonLuckyRecommendedBeat7Obviously one of the most visually beautiful games I've ever played... however, I would say it's more of a one time experience/installation piece and I don't necessarily mean that in a bad way.

I would've rated higher if the marriage between its themes and gameplay was slightly better handled. Celeste came to mind straight away while playing this and how much better it portrayed mental health struggles through its level design. Gris a lot of the time can just feel like you're going from left to right to get the thing that'll take you to the next stage with no real weight behind it.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleDifficultyMore...Mar 1, 202520Only visible to youZa_UvekRecommendedBeat8Wow, GRIS is now easily one of my favourite games of all time. A lot of people throw around the old â€œthis is video game artâ€ for a lot of indie titles these days. But GRIS, is the very embodiment of art on it's own.

The game acts as a allegory for a girl overcoming grief or just a hard time through life in general. Regardless whether the message catches you or not, the sound, art style and animation will bombard your senses in a way that it's hard to disengage from. Really, everything has been shaped and moulded with the game-play toward what is close to perfection.

As for the game-play itself, it's pretty standard 2-D puzzle plat-former stuff and might seem rudimentary at first. But as the game progresses, the puzzles will stop to make you think and are surprisingly clever, but not hard enough to stop the flow of the game.

This game is worth every cent. And honestly, it is very hard to express what you'll be in for, so it's best experienced yourself. Please do add it to your collection even if you are slightly interested.Jun 8, 202510Only visible to youYNGLemonHopeRecommendedBeat10Beautiful, short and sweet experience that feels like more art than game. The controls were fluid and fun and the gameplay was simple but enjoyable. The music and sound design were amazing, felt very immersed in the beautiful environments. The story was simple but impactful, more through context than laying it out for you, which added to the overall atmosphere. Really loved it.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 18, 202510Only visible to youStrowckerRecommendedBeat9This game tauch me how to lose, not in a bad way, but as a lesson of life. It shows you how to lead with lost, how to keep going after all seems out of meaning. Life it's unfair and this is not only for you, everyone passes to a difficult time in life, and then you find a new significance to it eventually. It can be a new chance to what you already wanted, or a new thing, the future is never as we think it will be, and that's why you must live your present, and do your chooses daily. Of course, you aways must have a "north" where to go, but that's also about it, sometimes this north just disappear and you don't have even a compass anymore, and then life gives you the stars so you can learn how to guide yourself by the constellations, it's hard of course, but is the chance you have now and you need lead with that.

But talking about the game itself now, it's really really really beautiful, in all the ways it can be, scenarios, soundtrack, history, everything. The first time I saw this game was because of Cellbit, and I was about to watch it, but I perceived that wasn't any game, I felt it was a deep one, something I had to experience by myself, and it was a great choice, make my own interpretation about what I experienced, have my own feelings about what I saw, it was just magic. 

Furthermore, I played it near one of the most tragic experiences of sadness of my life, breaking up with my first and only girlfriend I had by now. We had a little more than one year together, but it seemed a lot more, and I lost her, because a mistake I have made. And after that I saw that I lead with that in a similar way that Gris leaded with her pain, ironically... Maybe was a sign of the universe.

This game have a incredibly short gameplay, but it's something you'll difficultly forget. I difficulty cry with things, but I dropped some tears at the ending, and it wasn't even because it was sad, it was actually very happy, and I felt amazed by everything. Just amazing.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jan 2, 202510Only visible to youbluearacherRecommended7Esoteric story wise, leaving you to find your own meaning out of a pastiche of broken landscapes but a fun puzzler that lasts a short while. The art style was amazing and the saving grace of the whole experience.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Dec 24, 202410Only visible to youvishalj27RecommendedBeat7What an amazing journey.
You will get goosebumps every 10 secs. Mark my words.

Its not perfect though.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCheerfulMore...Dec 22, 202410Only visible to youO_Xerife_RecommendedBeat9Just feelLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleLevel DesignMore...Dec 21, 202410Only visible to youDanielRecommendedBeat10A very short masterpiece that plays their small moveset pretty wise and surprises the player every short number of seconds. A pleasure to have played a jewel like this.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCheerfulMore...Oct 24, 202410Only visible to youshortforedwinaRecommendedBeat10This review contains spoilers.ShowLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jan 8, 202410Only visible to youf-r-e-s-kNot RecommendedBeat16d ago00Only visible to youMrme117RecommendedBeat77d ago00Only visible to youwally.mcRecommendedBeat7LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleImmersionMore...7d ago00Only visible to youvegalejRecommendedBeat810d ago00Only visible to youdossavRecommendedBeat713d ago00Only visible to youKrisSanchezNot RecommendedBeat613d ago00Only visible to youTellurixRecommendedBeat8Nov 11, 202500Only visible to youbirb_burpRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Oct 12, 202400Only visible to youjoselawisRecommendedBeat8Nov 5, 202500Only visible to youCalibur94RecommendedBeat10LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Nov 4, 202500

Regardless whether the message catches you or not, the sound, art style and animation will bombard your senses in a way that it's hard to disengage from. Really, everything has been shaped and moulded with the game-play toward what is close to perfection.

As for the game-play itself, it's pretty standard 2-D puzzle plat-former stuff and might seem rudimentary at first. But as the game progresses, the puzzles will stop to make you think and are surprisingly clever, but not hard enough to stop the flow of the game.

This game is worth every cent. And honestly, it is very hard to express what you'll be in for, so it's best experienced yourself. Please do add it to your collection even if you are slightly interested.Jun 8, 202510Only visible to youYNGLemonHopeRecommendedBeat10Beautiful, short and sweet experience that feels like more art than game. The controls were fluid and fun and the gameplay was simple but enjoyable. The music and sound design were amazing, felt very immersed in the beautiful environments. The story was simple but impactful, more through context than laying it out for you, which added to the overall atmosphere. Really loved it.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 18, 202510Only visible to youStrowckerRecommendedBeat9This game tauch me how to lose, not in a bad way, but as a lesson of life. It shows you how to lead with lost, how to keep going after all seems out of meaning. Life it's unfair and this is not only for you, everyone passes to a difficult time in life, and then you find a new significance to it eventually. It can be a new chance to what you already wanted, or a new thing, the future is never as we think it will be, and that's why you must live your present, and do your chooses daily. Of course, you aways must have a "north" where to go, but that's also about it, sometimes this north just disappear and you don't have even a compass anymore, and then life gives you the stars so you can learn how to guide yourself by the constellations, it's hard of course, but is the chance you have now and you need lead with that.

But talking about the game itself now, it's really really really beautiful, in all the ways it can be, scenarios, soundtrack, history, everything. The first time I saw this game was because of Cellbit, and I was about to watch it, but I perceived that wasn't any game, I felt it was a deep one, something I had to experience by myself, and it was a great choice, make my own interpretation about what I experienced, have my own feelings about what I saw, it was just magic. 

Furthermore, I played it near one of the most tragic experiences of sadness of my life, breaking up with my first and only girlfriend I had by now. We had a little more than one year together, but it seemed a lot more, and I lost her, because a mistake I have made. And after that I saw that I lead with that in a similar way that Gris leaded with her pain, ironically... Maybe was a sign of the universe.

This game have a incredibly short gameplay, but it's something you'll difficultly forget. I difficulty cry with things, but I dropped some tears at the ending, and it wasn't even because it was sad, it was actually very happy, and I felt amazed by everything. Just amazing.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jan 2, 202510Only visible to youbluearacherRecommended7Esoteric story wise, leaving you to find your own meaning out of a pastiche of broken landscapes but a fun puzzler that lasts a short while. This game is FOLLIA :)LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Aug 13, 202510Only visible to youCanadian_VikingrRecommendedBeat99d ago00Only visible to youJoey StrickerNot RecommendedBeat79d ago00Only visible to youauroruhhhRecommendedBeat8LIKED & DISLIKEDMain StoryReplayabilityMore...9d ago00Only visible to youdecipher05RecommendedBeat1012d ago00Only visible to youCaieraRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...12d ago00Only visible to youStarcoreRecommendedBeat812d ago00Only visible to youPercoco90RecommendedBeat9Nov 5, 202500Only visible to youliamlarke88RecommendedBeat8Nov 1, 202500Only visible to youTerrenceNot RecommendedPaused5Nier: Automata is one of the most highly regarded games of the decade. (Dark Souls is one of the few games of the decade held in higher esteem.) It has several elements that I enjoy in modern video games. Most notably:

Open world design
Combat designed by Platinum Games (Bayonetta, Metal Gear Rising, Transformers: Cybertron, etc)


I'm upset with Nier: Automata. I was bored and out like a light for the first 15 hours of this game. I was being nice as I wandered through this barren world, harvesting trash and slicing robot fodder into trash. This game is the equivalent of ripping a decent story into tiny pieces and scattering it over a football stadium.

The open world is barren to a fault. Whereas good open world games provide a large variety of content that is worth seeking out, most of Nierâ€™s world is an empty space that must be traversed on foot for extended periods of time. There is no fast travel in this part of the game, and little to do so except haul yourself back and forth over the barren world, there is little reward to exploration. The combat quickly becomes tedious, since it mostly involves mashing on the attack button while your drone whittles down the mobs you face. By Platinum Games standards, not very deep.

Many of the early missions arenâ€™t very well designed, either. Some of them are based on enemy loot drops that donâ€™t appear. It doesnâ€™t help that the broken map doesnâ€™t properly show the location of these harvesting missions. I spent nearly an hour trying to figure out why I couldnâ€™t complete one early mission.

The story might be good, but as my â€œripping into tiny piece*****ogy states, that story is parceled out in such unsatisfyingly minor chunks that it feel like its spinning its wheels instead of making a point. Narrative efficiency seems irrelevant here. Which might be the point, but itâ€™s an awfully pretentious way to make such a point.LIKED & DISLIKEDPacingProgressionMore...Oct 31, 202500Only visible to youpsalmamosNot RecommendedBeat6This isnâ€™t the masterpiece I thought it was, had moments of deep reflection but doesnâ€™t do anything with it. This game is the equivalent of ripping a decent story into tiny pieces and scattering it over a football stadium.

The open world is barren to a fault. Whereas good open world games provide a large variety of content that is worth seeking out, most of Nierâ€™s world is an empty space that must be traversed on foot for extended periods of time. There is no fast travel in this part of the game, and little to do so except haul yourself back and forth over the barren world, there is little reward to exploration. The combat quickly becomes tedious, since it mostly involves mashing on the attack button while your drone whittles down the mobs you face. By Platinum Games standards, not very deep.

Many of the early missions arenâ€™t very well designed, either. Some of them are based on enemy loot drops that donâ€™t appear. It doesnâ€™t help that the broken map doesnâ€™t properly show the location of these harvesting missions. I spent nearly an hour trying to figure out why I couldnâ€™t complete one early mission.

The story might be good, but as my â€œripping into tiny piece*****ogy states, that story is parceled out in such unsatisfyingly minor chunks that it feel like its spinning its wheels instead of making a point. Narrative efficiency seems irrelevant here. Which might be the point, but itâ€™s an awfully pretentious way to make such a point.LIKED & DISLIKEDPacingProgressionMore...Oct 31, 202500Only visible to youpsalmamosNot RecommendedBeat6This isnâ€™t the masterpiece I thought it was, had moments of deep reflection but doesnâ€™t do anything with it. Has high highs but sluggish lows. The gameplay is truely so boring after the first 4  hours, but the medium is used very wellOct 31, 202500Only visible to youUsayaRecommendedBeat9Oct 30, 202500Only visible to youNunoRecommendedBeat8Oct 30, 202500Only visible to youFrancesco OrtiliRecommended9Oct 28, 202500Only visible to yousono0RecommendedBeat8Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youArganueRecommendedBeat9Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youIsaiahRecommendedBeat10Oct 26, 202500Only visible to youWillExoticRecommendedBeat9Oct 25, 202500

From the very start, you get a sense of how grand your adventure will be when you plunge into the depths of the Forgotten Crossroads. 

From there,  you dash, slash, and jump through every single room looking to unravel the mystery of Hollownest's fate. And speaking of slashing and jumping, Hollow Knight features the best movement I think I have ever played in a video game. The Knight moves just quick enough, jumps just high enough (with upgrades to this movement coming as you play) to make every interaction with enemies, platforms, and bosses feel buttery smooth.

Hollow Knight's combat also feels so satisfying (special nod to the sound design, I will literally never get tired of the shpleck sound of your nail striking enemies). The game is hard, sometimes frustratingly so, but as many players before me mention, fights can almost always be overcome with clever charm strategies and really focusing on attack patterns. 

Maybe most importantly, the game is also stunningly beautiful. Each new area felt so well cared for and meticulously designed with floors, backgrounds, and enemies to match their atmospheres. 

After beating the main storyline, I was totally motivated to keep playing since I know there's tons more to collect, beat, and discover. But I must admit, I have lost just a bit of steam with getting to that coveted 112% clear rate, because like I said before, everything now is pretty darn hard. But so fun. So I still can't put down this beauty of a game. One of the best games I've ever played and easily the standard for a metroidvania.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 6, 202520Only visible to youEdge901900RecommendedBeat9Review: Hollow Knight â€” A Masterpiece of Darkness and Discovery

Few games manage to blend beauty, melancholy, and challenge as seamlessly as Hollow Knight. Team Cherryâ€™s indie gem isnâ€™t just a platformer or an action game â€” itâ€™s a quiet odyssey through a fallen world, one that rewards curiosity and perseverance in equal measure.
From the moment you descend into Hallownest, you feel it: the weight of a kingdom long dead, whispering through the ruins. The world is vast and interconnected, filled with hidden paths, cryptic characters, and secrets tucked just out of reach. Every new area feels distinct â€” from the tranquil decay of Greenpath to the eerie depths of Deepnest â€” all painted in a somber, hand-drawn art style thatâ€™s both beautiful and haunting.

The combat is deceptively simple yet brutally fair. The Knightâ€™s nail strikes with precision, and every upgrade â€” from charms to spells â€” adds depth without diluting the difficulty. Bosses are fierce and unforgettable, each one a test of patience, skill, and rhythm. Victory never feels cheap; every triumph is earned.

But what truly makes Hollow Knight extraordinary is its atmosphere. Christopher Larkinâ€™s score drifts between sorrow and serenity, perfectly echoing the loneliness and quiet hope that define Hallownest. The storytelling is subtle, buried in item descriptions, environmental hints, and fleeting dialogue. Itâ€™s a narrative you uncover, not one youâ€™re told â€” and that makes it all the more powerfulLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Nov 6, 202510Only visible to youJoshuatooker43RecommendedBeat10Sep 17, 202510Only visible to youMrAlmendritasRecommendedBeat10Odio las polillas y amo al caballeritoLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Sep 20, 202510Only visible to youMcAirthRecommendedBeat10Hollow knight is a game that will last the test of age and has for me so far. Easy 10/10 game for meLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 29, 202310Only visible to youRytymRecommendedBeat10Dec 27, 202310Only visible to youKayonji_RecommendedBeat8A modern metroidvania with souls-like elements like difficulty, methodic boss battles and soul system. 

The art is simply superb, blending 2D and 3D flawlessly, with a beautiful and detailed world. The music is also absolutely top notch. The controls are precise, some of the best I've ever seen in 2D games.

My only problem with this game was the exploration: by giving too much freedom and places to go all at once, it was pretty common for me to run all around the world, finding progress wall after progress walls because I hadn't unlocked the required upgrades yet. The result was constant backtracking, and so many pins (markers) on the map that you eventually lose control of what is what - leading to more backtracking when you get an upgrade and have to revisit every pin on the map to see if it was the progress wall fit for your recent upgrade. I got lost many times, and at almost all of them I felt  that it was the level design's fault, not mine. 

In short, Hollow Knight is a fantastic game, with top notch art direction, but packed with some dubious level design choices here and there that will make you lose time and patience - and because of that some will drop the game out of sheer frustration.

P.s: seasoned Metroidvania and Soulsborne player here.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Dec 13, 202313Only visible to youlezalmosRecommendedBeat10Oct 29, 202310

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJneRecommendedBeat8This game wrecked me emotionallyLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...May 25, 202440Only visible to youscxrabRecommended9life is strange II>life is strange ILIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Aug 28, 202430Only visible to youPandaprdRecommendedBeat9Life is Strange 2 is simply just a really great game that lives up to the original game. 

This game maintains the core elements of the first game while also daring to do something new by having the two main protagonists travel the country together. 

The story is truly remarkable showing the struggles of two brothers. 

I one of Life is Strange 2â€™s strengths is its willingness to address relevant social issues. Racism and police violence are at the forefront of the game, but it also touches on themes of family, personal responsibility, and belonging. Usually these themes are handled pretty well and portrayed in a realistic manner. 

Visually Life is strange 2 is beautiful and Ana amazing soundtrack to compliment every scene.

Overall a beautiful game that I definitely will be playing again and would highly recommend to anyone who is a fan of great storytelling.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Sep 17, 202420Only visible to youli4mhgRecommendedBeat9does every lis game want to give me depression?LIKED & DISLIKEDCharactersCommunityMore...May 25, 202420Only visible to youChrisRecommendedBeat10This review contains spoilers.ShowLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Aug 12, 202410Only visible to youchrisRecommendedBeat7Got the most brutal ending that made me uninstall the game. Very satisfying though. Heartbreaking story if imperfectLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleJul 18, 202410Only visible to youBas van DunRecommendedBeat9Life is Strange 2 takes the successful narrative-driven formula of the first game and ventures into new, more mature territories. This episodic adventure follows the Diaz brothers, Sean and Daniel, who are forced to flee their Seattle home after a tragic incident leaves them on the run from the law.

The game's strength lies in its emotional depth and character development. Sean, as the older brother, assumes a parental role, guiding Daniel and influencing his moral compass through the decisions players make. This dynamic is at the heart of the game, providing a poignant exploration of brotherhood, responsibility, and the loss of innocence.

The journey across America is fraught with socio-political themes, including immigration, racism, and identity, making Life is Strange 2 more grounded and relevant than its predecessor. These themes are woven into the narrative seamlessly, often presenting morally grey choices that challenge players' perspectives.

You know that a game does something with you when the endscreen turns black and you just see yourself staring at the tv. This is a game that does this. Lesson learned.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jun 25, 202410Only visible to youJesÃºs LarreaNot RecommendedBeat6Bad gameplay, BUT really bad.

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youTh3On3Fr33manRecommendedBeat7This is a dark compelling story with great performances and interesting characters. 

The gameplay was just alright - the movement is way too slow, the puzzles are repetitive and the load screens on Switch are way too long. The map could be better - hard to see and unclear where to go at times. 

However, the decision making process was interesting and some of your choices do the change the outcome in a meaningful way. 

I'm glad I played it - I'm gonna skip the sequel though.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityCharactersMore...Dec 18, 202330Only visible to youhiespinRecommended8A game that can feel slow due to design, but it is an incredibly thoughtful experience on what people can linger on and what they are willing to let go.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Dec 28, 202410Only visible to youQweastRecommendedBeat8Gripping story with nice twists and turns throughout. Art style is awesome and the environments plus the ambience will keep you on your toes. Looking forward to the sequel.Mar 3, 202310Only visible to youPesitarioRecommendedBeat8This game is a very good fit for a rainy weekend and should be enjoyed with a calm mind and a warm tea.

Mechanically it falls somewhere inbetween a modern puzzle-game like â€Limboâ€œ or â€Insideâ€œ and a classic adventure with pointâ€˜nâ€˜click vibes and interesting dialogue and good voice-acting.

The sum of itâ€˜s parts combine to a moody â€X-Filesâ€œ-like experience, that is driven by itâ€˜s strong sound-design, tense mystery and like-able characters.

I played through it on a weekend and the experience stuck with me for years.

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youTh3On3Fr33manRecommendedBeat7This is a dark compelling story with great performances and interesting characters. 

The gameplay was just alright - the movement is way too slow, the puzzles are repetitive and the load screens on Switch are way too long. The map could be better - hard to see and unclear where to go at times. 

However, the decision making process was interesting and some of your choices do the change the outcome in a meaningful way.

Art style is awesome and the environments plus the ambience will keep you on your toes. Looking forward to the sequel.Mar 3, 202310Only visible to youPesitarioRecommendedBeat8This game is a very good fit for a rainy weekend and should be enjoyed with a calm mind and a warm tea.

Mechanically it falls somewhere inbetween a modern puzzle-game like â€Limboâ€œ or â€Insideâ€œ and a classic adventure with pointâ€˜nâ€˜click vibes and interesting dialogue and good voice-acting.

The sum of itâ€˜s parts combine to a moody â€X-Filesâ€œ-like experience, that is driven by itâ€˜s strong sound-design, tense mystery and like-able characters.

I played through it on a weekend and the experience stuck with me for years.

Aside from its obvious strength in art direction, it manages to encapsulate such an unique experience mainly through its story-telling abilities. It truly is, as Killmonday Games claims, an interactive narrative. Even though it is a short game, its replay-ability is fantastic due to the different choices you have as our main character, Misfortune. My only complaint is its price. Even though it's a wonderful game, $30 (AUD) is a bit much for 3 hours of game play, even if it should be replayed as previously mentioned. It might take away from the experience if players feel done in by the end of it.

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youperoRecommendedPaused8i love the first part, the rest idcDec 27, 202340Only visible to youfallenartemieRecommendedBeat7I don't really like card games or deck builders but I do like horror, psychological, and rogue like games. That is what got me to try this game out. What's not to like? It's perfectly eerie, not jumpscary. It's slick, with fast card animations and a easy to understand cost and play mechanic. What I really enjoyed was the story and how many times it surprised me. This game looks normal on the face but it's complex and interesting. The ending was really cool and some of the boss battles had amazing ambiance, visuals, and music that I won't forget. Definitely worth a play, it won't take you more than 20 hours at max to beat the story and afterwards, you'll always have a replayable game to relax with.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Sep 4, 202320Only visible to youjustyouknowhyytNot RecommendedQuit51st half is incredible - 2nd half is an incorrigible slog that inexplicably changes the mechanics that worked for it before. user_id: PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youEkam_InhaleRecommended10The definitive Deck Builder.LIKED & DISLIKEDBalanceCharactersMore...Dec 1, 202321Only visible to youJoseRecommendedBeat8I loved Slay the Spire! This was my first roguelike years ago, and I wasn't able to finish it back then. But I recently picked it up on mobile. After playing games like Hades and Balatro I got a better concept and understanding of what roguelike is. Also, this is a fantastic game and my favorite part of it is the difficulty. It feels much more balanced than the other two I mentioned. It's almost like in most roguelikes, you can spike up or down in terms of power. However, Slay the Spire always feels like you have a chance. I'm a fan, and in some ways, I have more fun with it than more popular roguelikes. This game is definitely worth playing and replaying if you haven't played it in a while, or if, like me, you never got too deep into it.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Apr 16, 202510Only visible to youDbusnelliRecommendedBeat10The most addicting and satisfying game ever. 10/10LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 16, 202410Only visible to youDan StapletonRecommendedBeat10Apr 12, 202411Only visible to yougreggins89RecommendedBeat8Oct 22, 202500Only visible to youjosephgilbert99RecommendedBeat109d ago00Only visible to youSSimonHRecommendedBeat8Feb 24, 202400Only visible to youkboennerRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDCombatCustomizationMore...10d ago00Only visible to youpierreshad63RecommendedBeat813d ago00Only visible to youTellurixRecommendedBeat9Nov 11, 202500Only visible to youYazeed R.RecommendedBeat8Overall - 8.5Sep 15, 202500Only visible to youMusadiqRecommendedBeat8Amazing game, still got more runs to conquerLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Oct 23, 202500Only visible to youBlack Hole BombRecommended8LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityDifficultyMore...Nov 5, 202500Only visible to youSpeedyxzRecommendedBeat10Nov 2, 202500Only visible to yougodshallcsNot RecommendedBeat6Nov 1, 202500Only visible to youDebitoPubblicoRecommendedPaused8Oct 30, 202500Only visible to yousono0RecommendedBeat8Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youqaundraRecommendedBeat8Oct 25, 202500Only visible to youDonteRecommendedQuit8Oct 22, 202500Only visible to youPo1211RecommendedPlaying10Oct 22, 202500

Basically a boss rush but such a unique concept and so well designed.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 14, 202520Only visible to youcopRecommendedBeat10te amo cumhedMay 26, 202520Only visible to youcolt-RecommendedBeat9Cuphead -  A Rewarding Challenge Wrapped In Nostaglia
Progress: Platinum Trophy + 100%â€™d DLC 

As soon as I launched Cuphead on my PS4, I was immediately struck by its unique aesthetic. The gameâ€™s hand-drawn animation, inspired by 1930s cartoons, is nothing short of breathtaking. The visual style feels authentic and refreshingâ€”especially in an era where most 2D side-scrollers follow a familiar, often predictable, formula. Cuphead feels like a love letter to classic animation, with vibrant colors, quirky character designs, and an old-school vibe that sets it apart from nearly every other game in the genre.
Gameplay-wise, Cuphead is a beast. The bosses are as tough as they are creative, each one offering a new challenge that demands precision, patience, and quick reflexes. The difficulty spike can be brutal at timesâ€”especially the expert mode S-rank challenges and the pacifist runs, where youâ€™re tasked with completing levels without killing any enemies. These challenges pushed my skills to the limit and truly tested my perseverance. If you love a tough challenge, this game will satisfy that craving, but be prepared to grind.
While I played solo, I can only imagine how chaotic and fun it must be in co-op mode. Thereâ€™s something about the cooperative aspect of Cuphead that just feels like it would amplify the challenge, making it even more rewarding. For those like me who tackle it alone, however, the sense of accomplishment after defeating a particularly tough boss is incredibly satisfying.
One thing that made my experience smoother was switching up the controller layout settings. If youâ€™re diving into Cuphead, I highly recommend adjusting the attack and gun fire buttons to R2 or a trigger button, it makes a world of difference during intense moments. If youâ€™re into games that challenge you to improve with every attempt, Cuphead is a must-play.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Nov 23, 202420Only visible to youkatyRecommendedQuit8SO HARD. but I'm also bad at games lol.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Jul 4, 202320Only visible to youIdlRecommendedBeat8divertido, dificultad perfecta, y un estilo de arte brutal. necesitamos mÃ¡s juegos boss rush

8,5/10Aug 16, 202410Only visible to youOptimus_BelmontRecommended7Cuphead is brutally hard, but the more you play it the better you get. It doesnâ€™t feel unfair but it does test oneâ€™s metal. I died 545 times before rolling credits. Love the 1930s old school cartoon aesthetic and jazzy score. The animation work is so well done. Hats off to this small indie studio. Not a lot of gameplay variety. Wasnâ€™t expecting it to be a series of boss battles but once you get used to the gameplay loop itâ€™s not bad. Looking forward to checking out the DLC later but need a break before jumping back in. Overall a good game!LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCombatMore...Jan 15, 202410Only visible to youCoevexRecommendedBeat10Nov 27, 202310Only visible to youbman0424RecommendedQuit10The art style alone is enough to warrant a good ratingJul 6, 202310Only visible to youohshiiirtNot Recommended1most difficult game EVERLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 26, 202315Only visible to youf-r-e-s-kRecommendedBeat106d ago00Only visible to youtinnsOMEGARecommendedBeat10Holy cow, dancing with the devil has never been so tempting.

In Cuphead, you'll find a truly grueling experience that keeps you coming back every time you lose just to get those boss patterns down. It's a formidable challenge and is surely to satiate all run-n-gun lovers seeking a well rounded, modern day Mega Man or Contra spiritual successor. 

-The gameplay is top notch with sharp and responsive player movement. 
-Bosses brimming with intense fun
-Stellar, stellar, stellar graphics. Absolute *chef's kiss*

It's silly but slightly dark. You'd be hard pressed to find a game quite like this anywhere. It is undoubtedly a timeless classic that could be played 200 years from now and look and feel beautiful. 

Sincerely a masterpiece that I wish I'd played sooner.

Now for the Delicious Last Course!

user_id: PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youfrankenthumbsRecommendedBeat10One of the most satisfying traversal/platforming in any gameJul 5, 202510Only visible to youSpencethefence7RecommendedBeat8Great metroidvania with a fun time shifting mechanic. It is unclear at times what you are intended to do though and there are odd difficulty spikes that hold this back from being an amazing game.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleDifficultyMore...Feb 1, 202510Only visible to youZa_UvekRecommendedBeat8This title is everything that is great about 2D platforming, but with a very nice twist that makes it stand out on its own. I found the overall story to be pretty standard at first glance. But as it progressed, I was pleased to see that the writing contained some great humour and cleverly tied into the platforming itself. I don't want to spoil anything, but the way the game transitions from normal platformer to metroidvania is brilliant! In saying that, there was some great character progression that accompanies some very tight gameplay. Every time things did get difficult it was tough but very fair. Needless to say, the gameplay blended in beautifully with the 8/16 bit graphics and top notch soundtrack. It's hard to write too much as this is a title that shouldn't be spoiled. It might look familiar at first glance, but under the surface you'll find a very original title indeed. user_id:
PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youcheesewedge12RecommendedQuit7Oct 26, 202500Only visible to youMax222222RecommendedBeat7Oct 15, 202500Only visible to youThe7thGodRecommendedPlaying8LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Sep 29, 202500Only visible to youDavidliam1966Not RecommendedBeat6Aug 22, 202500Only visible to youPtiBouchonNot RecommendedBeat6Jul 13, 202500Only visible to youLuitenant GruberRecommendedBeat7Fun game with fresh concept.

(Played via Remote Play)

There are many small indie games out there, many of them with exactly the same concept, idea, game mode etc. However, Unrailed! has something unique. You need to transport a train from point A to point B, while completing the tracks under its wheels. 

You need to collect stone and wood to build tracks, cool down the engine from time to time using a water bucket and keep an eye of the movement of the train at all times. The multitasking makes it fun, especially with friends, where everyone has a different task.

After each successful mission, you can buy upgrades for your train carts, making the later stages a little easier. However, in the later stages, the train will move faster and faster, giving you less time to complete the track.

When your little train crashes, it is game over. All progress, upgrades and carts are lost, and you may start over again. 

Unrailed! uses simple, "Minecraft" graphics which are fine for a simple game like this. The character models look silly and hilarious, especially when moving.

The sound effects and music are alright and just play nicely in the background.

Control wise, this game is very simple and easy to learn. 

Overall, I liked Unrailed! especially with some friends on a Saturday night. It offers some quick casual fun and with its unique concept, I would surely recommend it.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleFamily-FriendlyMore...Apr 23, 202500Only visible to youFrajolaNot RecommendedBeat6Apr 10, 202500Only visible to youImValllRecommendedQuit8LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 4, 202500Only visible to youFortyVsZeroNot Recommended6Feb 12, 202500Only visible to youSundanceRecommendedBeat7Jan 24, 202500Only visible to youÃlex!RecommendedBeat9Jan 11, 202500Only visible to yousasasaRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDMechanicsDec 17, 202400Only visible to youGamerRecommended8LIKED & DISLIKEDCo-opDifficultyMore...Oct 30, 202400Only visible to youGhernotRecommended10Oct 17, 202400Only visible to youXibaNot RecommendedBeat6Sep 12, 202400Only visible to youPunchitaRecommendedBeat8Jul 4, 202400Only visible to youAndreretsuRecommendedBeat8Jun 22, 202400Only visible to youDeezer34RecommendedQuit7LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCo-opMore...Jun 15, 202400Only visible to youJustcause97RecommendedBeat8Apr 14, 202400Only visible to youp4koNot RecommendedPlaying10Apr 13, 202400

After each successful mission, you can buy upgrades for your train carts, making the later stages a little easier. However, in the later stages, the train will move faster and faster, giving you less time to complete the track.

When your little train crashes, it is game over. All progress, upgrades and carts are lost, and you may start over again. 

Unrailed! uses simple, "Minecraft" graphics which are fine for a simple game like this. The character models look silly and hilarious, especially when moving.

The sound effects and music are alright and just play nicely in the background.

Control wise, this game is very simple and easy to learn. 

Overall, I liked Unrailed! especially with some friends on a Saturday night. It offers some quick casual fun and with its unique concept, I would surely recommend it.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleFamily-FriendlyMore...Apr 23, 202500Only visible to youFrajolaNot RecommendedBeat6Apr 10, 202500Only visible to youImValllRecommendedQuit8LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 4, 202500Only visible to youFortyVsZeroNot Recommended6Feb 12, 202500Only visible to youSundanceRecommendedBeat7Jan 24, 202500Only visible to youÃlex!RecommendedBeat9Jan 11, 202500Only visible to yousasasaRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDMechanicsDec 17, 202400Only visible to youGamerRecommended8LIKED & DISLIKEDCo-opDifficultyMore...Oct 30, 202400Only visible to youGhernotRecommended10Oct 17, 202400Only visible to youXibaNot RecommendedBeat6Sep 12, 202400Only visible to youPunchitaRecommendedBeat8Jul 4, 202400Only visible to youAndreretsuRecommendedBeat8Jun 22, 202400Only visible to youDeezer34RecommendedQuit7LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCo-opMore...Jun 15, 202400Only visible to youJustcause97RecommendedBeat8Apr 14, 202400Only visible to youp4koNot RecommendedPlaying10Apr 13, 202400

user_id:
Only visible to youcheesewedge12RecommendedQuit7Oct 26, 202500Only visible to youMax222222RecommendedBeat7Oct 15, 202500Only visible to youThe7thGodRecommendedPlaying8LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Sep 29, 202500Only visible to youDavidliam1966Not RecommendedBeat6Aug 22, 202500Only visible to youPtiBouchonNot RecommendedBeat6Jul 13, 202500Only visible to youLuitenant GruberRecommendedBeat7Fun game with fresh concept.

(Played via Remote Play)

There are many small indie games out there, many of them with exactly the same concept, idea, game mode etc. However, Unrailed! has something unique. You need to transport a train from point A to point B, while completing the tracks under its wheels. 

You need to collect stone and wood to build tracks, cool down the engine from time to time using a water bucket and keep an eye of the movement of the train at all times. The multitasking makes it fun, especially with friends, where everyone has a different task.

After each successful mission, you can buy upgrades for your train carts, making the later stages a little easier. However, in the later stages, the train will move faster and faster, giving you less time to complete the track.

When your little train crashes, it is game over. All progress, upgrades and carts are lost, and you may start over again. 

Unrailed! uses simple, "Minecraft" graphics which are fine for a simple game like this. The character models look silly and hilarious, especially when moving.

The sound effects and music are alright and just play nicely in the background.

Control wise, this game is very simple and easy to learn. 

Overall, I liked Unrailed! especially with some friends on a Saturday night. It offers some quick casual fun and with its unique concept, I would surely recommend it.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleFamily-FriendlyMore...Apr 23, 202500Only visible to youFrajolaNot RecommendedBeat6Apr 10, 202500Only visible to youImValllRecommendedQuit8LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 4, 202500Only visible to youFortyVsZeroNot Recommended6Feb 12, 202500Only visible to youSundanceRecommendedBeat7Jan 24, 202500Only visible to youÃlex!RecommendedBeat9Jan 11, 202500Only visible to yousasasaRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDMechanicsDec 17, 202400Only visible to youGamerRecommended8LIKED & DISLIKEDCo-opDifficultyMore...Oct 30, 202400Only visible to youGhernotRecommended10Oct 17, 202400Only visible to youXibaNot RecommendedBeat6Sep 12, 202400Only visible to youPunchitaRecommendedBeat8Jul 4, 202400Only visible to youAndreretsuRecommendedBeat8Jun 22, 202400Only visible to youDeezer34RecommendedQuit7LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCo-opMore...Jun 15, 202400Only visible to youJustcause97RecommendedBeat8Apr 14, 202400Only visible to youp4koNot RecommendedPlaying10Apr 13, 202400

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youProphittRecommendedBeat9LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCombatMore...Apr 28, 202510Only visible to youRebelk90RecommendedQuit8Aug 1, 202410Only visible to youLuÃ­s PhilipeRecommendedBeat10LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 31, 202410Only visible to youvanenryRecommendedBeat10Jul 31, 202410Only visible to youyasRecommendedBeat106/22/24: This is the first rogue-lite to truly pull me into it's vortex. The soundtrack is AMAZING and the combination of metroidvania combat + rogue-lite elements create a perfect storm. The gameplay loop is addicting and the rush of finding a new enemy you haven't come across yet is both exciting and terrifying. 

And have I mentioned the weapons?? There's seemingly so much build variation and none feel boring or underpowered. Every time I found something new to try, whether a primary weapon or equipment, I was genuinely excited because I knew I'd be in for a treat.

This game has me looking forward to trying more rogue-lites, but there's also no doubt in my mind that I'll be returning to Dead Cells for a long time. I can't wait to explore more of the DLCs and dive further into the post-game / end-game content.

My one gripe is there isn't really an enticing story, but this game is so good I honestly don't mind. Looking forward to finding more interesting lore nuggets as I continue to play though.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Jun 22, 202410Only visible to youBiduAliveRecommendedBeat7Ã“timo, apesar de nÃ£o ser mto recompensador ir atrÃ¡s do Ãºltimo final por demandar muito tempo e nÃ£o.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jan 28, 202410Only visible to yougodshallcsNot RecommendedQuit67d ago00Only visible to youHal2004RecommendedBeat910d ago00Only visible to youpierreshad63RecommendedBeat813d ago00Only visible to youfacundo91RecommendedBeat8Nov 10, 202500Only visible to youSauroMLMNot RecommendedQuit7Nov 9, 202500Only visible to youR4P1D_7311Recommended9Nov 5, 202500Only visible to youjsf75RecommendedPaused8Nov 3, 202500Only visible to youKablebytesRecommended9LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Nov 3, 202500Only visible to youdrep14RecommendedBeat7Nov 2, 202500Only visible to youfilipkillanderRecommendedBeat10Nov 11, 202400Only visible to youbfndytyjwzNot Recommended6A deep rogue-like with endless discoveries awaiting, but not waters Iâ€™m wonâ€™t to swim in. PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youinnersaboteurRecommendedPlaying9One of my first rogue-like experiences, but really enjoyed the variable gameplay mechanics (i.e. permanent character/ability upgrades, various weapon/combat mechanics) as well as other features character & relationship development, voice acting, art style, etc.) The Greek mythology theming & darker/ethereal aesthetic pair perfectly together, and the gradual progression makes the title accessible to beginners without trivializing later content; however, you will likely find out that pure button-mashing results in multiple wipes (but endless runs & tremendous replay value) as you learn the ropes.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Feb 6, 202420Only visible to youPedroRLowRecommendedBeat8Gets Kind of repetitive, but the amazing art style and gameplay make up for it.Mar 4, 202320Only visible to youQweastRecommendedBeat10Stunning dungeon crawler with so many unique weapons, storylines and upgrades you'll find yourself completing runs countless times to unlock everything you can. Always a treat to play, definitely looking forward to the second one.Mar 3, 202320Only visible to youatucker01Recommended10This is the closest game that there is to a perfect roguelite. PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJasperDMRecommendedPaused711d ago00Only visible to youbfndytyjwzNot Recommended6Satisfying if generic tongue-in-cheek rogue-lite.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Nov 2, 202500Only visible to youIamZayraRecommendedBeat9Nov 1, 202500Only visible to yousono0RecommendedBeat8Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youTheSilencer810Recommended9LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityCheerfulMore...Oct 19, 202500Only visible to youPolloDoritosRecommendedBeat7Oct 15, 202500Only visible to youWolvshadeRecommendedQuit7Oct 14, 202500Only visible to yourhasko17RecommendedBeat9Apr 27, 202400Only visible to yousjceNot RecommendedBeat6Oct 13, 202500Only visible to youRecommendedBeat8Sep 11, 202500Only visible to youAlexRecommendedPaused7Sep 3, 202500Only visible to youKiQBarSilRecommendedBeat8Viciante, apesar de ter algumas dificuldades para aprimorar o personagem entre a metade e o final do jogoLIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCombatMore...Aug 25, 202500Only visible to youZa_UvekRecommendedPaused8You want your 'rouge-likes/lights', then this is easily one of the kings! Rouge Legacy 2 is everything the first one was but improved. The newly animated visuals really pop out compared to the last game. The story and world has a tiny bit more depth than before. And there has been some solid tweaks to the controlling to make a much smoother experience. Not to mention the core game-play is one of the best in the genre. From the boss battles, level designs and 'heritage' experience system, everything makes for a fun and unique game.

I loved the first Rogue Legacy and it's sequel supersedes it in every way. PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youWindelfurzNot RecommendedQuit2Jul 24, 202410Only visible to youThiphobiaRecommendedQuit6LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 6, 202410Only visible to youmarionggNot RecommendedBeat6Jun 28, 202410Only visible to youesimp18Not RecommendedQuit6This game is fun at first but there are issues with replayability, scaling, and incentive to play.

There is only one level and its a small square. Its not bad at first but it feels very plain after a while. Even though vampire survivors levels are really empty, the small differences help keep the levels entertaining. This game feels repetitive cuz the level is always the same. They should at least add some obstacles or something. 

The game doesnt really scale well. I played on the second difficulty level and could not get past round 16. I dont believe its because of my skill or poor luck. I tried to beat it for hours and i would always die cuz i either couldnt outrun something or i would get swarmed & couldnt kill quick enough.

The game also lacks the incentive to play. The only incentive is to unlock the 60 characters. Usually i would like this but every character feels very similar so they all blend together. You also unlock a ton of them at the beggining but the rest are locked behind difficult requirements. Once i stopped unlocking characters and i kept getting stuck on the same round, i lost interest and gave up.Jun 20, 202410Only visible to youIchigo0VarelaNot Recommended6Apr 29, 202410Only visible to youKumaThePowerfulNot RecommendedBeat6Apr 8, 202410Only visible to youSebastian ThylinNot RecommendedQuit6Mar 20, 202410Only visible to youwjuninNot RecommendedQuit2Mar 16, 202410Only visible to youAndresitoNot RecommendedBeat5Nov 9, 202500Only visible to youTupperkingRecommendedBeat7Nov 3, 202500Only visible to yougairarrRecommendedBeat9Nov 2, 202500Only visible to youGoodGuyJudgyRecommendedBeat7Oct 30, 202500Only visible to youFabuloniusRecommendedBeat10Jan 21, 202500Only visible to youISPMPGRecommendedBeat10Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youAcherontRecommended8Sep 21, 202500Only visible to youRaksopgRecommendedPlaying9LIKED & DISLIKEDBalanceCombatMore...Sep 18, 202500Only visible to youTitanACRecommended7Sep 6, 202500Only visible to youRecommendedBeat10Aug 29, 202500Only visible to youchillibrown420Recommended10Aug 26, 202500Only visible to youbugxiii-iiRecommendedBeat7Aug 20, 202500

Building the sequel around MelinoÃ« was so perfect. The quests, characters, and world-building are multilayered and sophisticated while staying true to the originalâ€™s spirit. Like the Hades I, the graphics are breathtaking. Combat is balanced, fluid, and endlessly re-playable, with new weapons that give you a creative set of combos by Olympian boons. The new Arcana card system adds another layer of strategy that makes every run feel different if you want to experiment with them.
As a Greek, Iâ€™m blown away by the respect and creativity in how the studio use mythology. They nailed the details, the characters, and the storytelling accuracy, while keeping it fun and modern. The amount of care put into the narrative is unbelievable. Seriously. This is one of the very few sequels that it's a masterpiece and not just another sequel.
To Supergiant: the Hades universe DESERVES an animated series.

user_id:
PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youRebelScum9RecommendedBeat8Nov 9, 202500Only visible to youScribbleHanRecommendedPaused7Nov 3, 202500Only visible to youCliothemuseRecommendedQuit7Sep 22, 202500Only visible to youBozaoRecommendedBeat10Sep 1, 202500Only visible to youS4MT0RR3SRecommendedPaused10This game is perfect if you like roguelikes and rhythm games.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Aug 24, 202500Only visible to youSuperGavinNot RecommendedQuit6May 5, 202500Only visible to youRippinRobotRecommendedBeat7Apr 26, 202500Only visible to youUrchinJoeRecommendedBeat6A retro Roguelike that looks like - and has the humour of - a 1980s fantasy board game.  I wanted to enjoy this much more than I did.  The concept, graphics, and sound design are all right up my alley.

I found the control scheme somehow simultaneously too simplistic and overly complex.  Access various zones from a central hub.  Push into the enemies to attack them, to the beat of the music.  Solve some light puzzles to defeat creative, characterful bosses and open new areas.

Early on I felt like victory was essentially random, with lucky drops making the difference between success and failure. 
 But despite the simplicity it's a steep learning curve, and the training zones became essential for me towards the end of the core story.  I don't know if it's partly the fault of the hardware - the stick and shoulder buttons of the Switch felt sluggish to me throughout - or just that pushing one button 99% of the time doesn't have enough depth to hold me, but practicing and ultimately beating the game started to feel like work.

I think I can still recommend Crypt of the Necrodancer if you're looking for something to obsess over and master, but right now it's not for me.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Apr 14, 202500Only visible to youSzymkowskyRecommendedQuit8Mar 26, 202500Only visible to youoilytr_v2RecommendedBeat10Mar 5, 202500Only visible to youPassttoukNot RecommendedBeat6Feb 28, 202500Only visible to youkurdeee740RecommendedBeat7Feb 20, 202500Only visible to youNimbolaRecommendedQuit8Jan 29, 202500Only visible to youÃ‰ric DampierreRecommendedPaused7Jan 4, 202500Only visible to youAJSpotoRecommendedBeat10Dec 30, 202400Only visible to youNorrrpliRecommendedBeat7Dec 23, 202400Only visible to youGracieMP3Not RecommendedQuit5Nov 25, 202400Only visible to youN3CORecommendedQuit8Im just not musical enough for this game =/LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleSound DesignMore...Oct 19, 202400Only visible to youpixelillyRecommendedQuit7LIKED & DISLIKEDCharactersDifficultyMore...Oct 8, 202400Only visible to youPapaWilfredoRecommendedBeat8Sep 25, 202400
review_text:
PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youRebelScum9RecommendedBeat8Nov 9, 202500Only visible to youScribbleHanRecommendedPaused7Nov 3, 202500Only visible to youCliothemuseRecommendedQuit7Sep 22, 202500Only visible to youBozaoRecommendedBeat10Sep 1, 202500Only visible to youS4MT0RR3SRecommendedPaused10This game is perfect if you like roguelikes and rhythm games.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Aug 24, 202500Only visible to youSuperGavinNot RecommendedQuit6May 5, 202500Only visible to youRippinRobotRecommendedBeat7Apr 26, 202500Only visible to youUrchinJoeRecommendedBeat6A retro Roguelike that looks like - and has the humour of - a 1980s fantasy board game.  I wanted to enjoy this much more than I did.  The concept, graphics, and sound design are all right up my alley.

I found the control scheme somehow simultaneously too simplistic and overly complex.  Access various zones from a central hub.  Push into the enemies to attack them, to the beat of the music.  Solve some light puzzles to defeat creative, characterful bosses and open new areas.

Early on I felt like victory was essentially random, with lucky drops making the difference between success and failure. 
 But despite the simplicity it's a steep learning curve, and the training zones became essential for me towards the end of the core story.  I don't know if it's partly the fault of the hardware - the stick and shoulder buttons of the Switch felt sluggish to me throughout - or just that pushing one button 99% of the time doesn't have enough depth to hold me, but practicing and ultimately beating the game started to feel like work.

I think I can still recommend Crypt of the Necrodancer if you're looking for something to obsess over and master, but right now it's not for me.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Apr 14, 202500Only visible to youSzymkowskyRecommendedQuit8Mar 26, 202500Only visible to youoilytr_v2RecommendedBeat10Mar 5, 202500Only visible to youPassttoukNot RecommendedBeat6Feb 28, 202500Only visible to youkurdeee740RecommendedBeat7Feb 20, 202500Only visible to youNimbolaRecommendedQuit8Jan 29, 202500Only visible to youÃ‰ric DampierreRecommendedPaused7Jan 4, 202500Only visible to youAJSpotoRecommendedBeat10Dec 30, 202400Only visible to youNorrrpliRecommendedBeat7Dec 23, 202400Only visible to youGracieMP3Not RecommendedQuit5Nov 25, 202400Only visible to youN3CORecommendedQuit8Im just not musical enough for this game =/LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleSound DesignMore...Oct 19, 202400Only visible to youpixelillyRecommendedQuit7LIKED & DISLIKEDCharactersDifficultyMore...Oct 8, 202400Only visible to youPapaWilfredoRecommendedBeat8Sep 25, 202400

Terrible experience. Do not understand how this won GOTY or how it would be considered for GOTY.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Mar 24, 2024434Only visible to youBreadBoi28RecommendedBeat10Sep 11, 202430Only visible to youSmolMightBiteRecommendedBeat9I FINALLY ****ING DID IT!!!! 

I AM THE ELDEN LORD!!!!! RAAAAAAHHHHHHH!!!!!

Oh my GOD! What a journey! My very first fromsoft game finished!!!! My inner child ****ing leapt for joy the moment it happened!!!! 

I only ever understood the feeling of playing these from an outsider looking in perspective!! For years I was terrified to take on the challenge. Is it hard? HELL YEA! Will it make you question your abilities?? MAYBE. Is it an absolutely MASSIVE undertaking?? OH. HEEEELLL YEA. Is it also an absolutely beautiful high fantasy game centered around exploration and proving to yourself that you can overcome every god damn challenge thatâ€™s thrown in your path??? HELL. ****ING. YEA!!!!!!!! Where I was once but a baby fan, watching from the sidelines. I now stand before you a full fledged ELDEN LORD!!! 

Now the game is of course stellar but I do have to say. As a ADHD having *** ***** the lack of even a journal for quests was a bit frustrating. But there is SO much to see and find and do that I feel many probably missed A-LOT on that first playthrough. Plus Iâ€™m a newbie to the genre so still have to get used to how questing in many of these works. 

I need more of these now. Iâ€™m officially apart of the souls-like cult. Onto Dark Souls 1 methinks!!LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Sep 18, 202430Only visible to youTwistedMetalGorgRecommended10Very good but need seamless co-op if you want to play with friendsLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Sep 5, 202430Only visible to youGiraffesAreAwesomeNot Recommended8As cool as this games open world is, I much prefer the level design and intricately woven together areas of previous Fromsoft titles. Dark Souls, Bloodbourne and Sekiro already felt massive in scale despite not being open world, not sure if we really needed this to be open world. I wouldnâ€™t mind it as much if I didnâ€™t have to go through what felt like the same 5 mini dungeons 1,000 times over. BUT, the legacy dungeons in this game stand among the series best. And all the main bosses in this game are incredible, the enemy design all around is phenomenal. In the end, this is big dark souls, for better or worse.Apr 7, 202430Only visible to youjrowland720Recommended9Absolutely amazing game that I will remember forever. Some critiques are valid, namely that it tends to drag a bit in the last third, but this game SLAPSMar 23, 202330Only visible to youLordHatchyRecommended10One of the best games ever made.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Nov 10, 202420Only visible to youltsephrRecommendedBeat8Sep 29, 202420Only visible to youTympanicChipRecommendedPaused9I am not great at these games so that really shows how good it is that iâ€™ve put 120+ hours into two characters. the hardest part about this game is me not trying to be so frustrated that i put it down, because revisiting this on a play through 60+ hours in is tough ****ing work. i want to get back in and finish it one day but iâ€™ll need greater patience than i have now.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCombatMore...Sep 11, 202420Only visible to youHatoenRecommendedPlaying10PatienceLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Sep 6, 202420Only visible to youmaxwellomarshallRecommendedPlaying10Its amazingLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 31, 202420Only visible to youbradenperkins70Recommended10This review contains spoilers.ShowLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jul 9, 202420Only visible to youcolbyslender64Recommended10You shouldn't need me to tell you this, but this game is a masterpiece. 

I started playing back during release, and stopped about 5% through the game. What a mistake that was! I didn't know what I was missing! This has to be my favorite open world game I have ever played. Elden Ring does not suffer the same issues as other open worlds. In this game, you are suggested the correct path, but you can go almost anywhere you want whenever you want, minus a few key bosses that unlock certain areas. When I say this game has hundreds of hours of content, I mean it. There is always something to do. Even when you finish the game, You can go back through it as many times as you want on the same character. By far my favorite feature of the game is the build crafting. Not only can you spec into hyper-specific builds that specialize greatly in a few skills, you can also completely change your build about a dozen times per save! If you end up not liking your build, there is a very early game boss that unlocks the ability to completely re-spec into whatever you want.

I have yet to beat this game, but I have been playing it for 100 hours and have yet to be tired of it at all. This game will grab you by the throat and never let go. The massive rush of dopamine after beating a tough boss is only found in Fromsoft games like this. Every victory feels like a revelation.

Highly recommended. 9.9/10. You just can't miss this one.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 27, 202420Only visible to youGrimnowNRecommendedBeat10This game blew me out of the water! When I first heard about Elden Ring, I was like "meh", but when I finally decided to give it a try and oh boy was it worth it. The map is huge, and there is so much content to do. Completing everything the game has to offer to the last nook and cranny will take over 150 hours for an average player, and it never gets boring.

The only negative thing I have to say is how the difficulty curves. It was a steady curve for the most part, but when you get to the endgame the difficulty spikes significantly, and suddenly you're struggling with the most basic enemies again. The whole game is frustrating because of the difficulty, which for a souls game isn't a problem, but the endgame was a new level of frustration, and took away from some of the fun from my experience. But who knows, maybe I was just playing unoptimally. 

Would definitely recommend for anyone who likes difficult games.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCo-opMore...Mar 3, 202420Only visible to yourobonix50RecommendedBeat10El besto souls y el besto mundo abierto, que mÃ¡s quieres?LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Dec 10, 202320Only visible to youCap0t3kawaiRecommendedBeat10Oct 29, 202321Only visible to youHonshu_WhoRecommended9The feeling of playing a massive game while your friends also play, and sharing your discoveries and tragedies... unmatched. It isn't the same experience when the game has been out for a while and everything you discover has been documented on a dozen different wikis.Sep 14, 202320Only visible to youLOcampos08RecommendedBeat9Jul 2, 202320
