I started playing back during release, and stopped about 5% through the game. What a mistake that was! I didn't know what I was missing! This has to be my favorite open world game I have ever played. Elden Ring does not suffer the same issues as other open worlds. In this game, you are suggested the correct path, but you can go almost anywhere you want whenever you want, minus a few key bosses that unlock certain areas. When I say this game has hundreds of hours of content, I mean it. There is always something to do. Even when you finish the game, You can go back through it as many times as you want on the same character. By far my favorite feature of the game is the build crafting. user_id:
TomRecommendedBeat10Lies of P capitalizes on some of the biggest disconnects (for me) in all the SoulsBorne games. 

It mixes this perfect balance of challenging combat, ambiguous world, mystery in discovery with a clear, concise narrative. 

It tackles challenging bosses while finding ways to help elevate the players who may not be looking for the grueling headache while still providing some pushback.

Its skill trees and weapon mechanics are beautifully done. 

One of best crafted games I've ever played. Some of the most fun I've had in an action adventure game. It's such a gemFeb 26, 202420

So, Mortal Shell is officially the first FromSoft-ish Souls-like I didnâ€™t rage-quit halfway through and uninstall out of pure self-loathing. Progress! ğŸ‰

Look, Iâ€™ve tried to join the â€œGit Gudâ€ cult and be That Guy who flexes about finishing Dark Souls and Bloodborne. Reality check:

Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition prepared me to die - repeatedly.

Bloodborne convinced me I was ready as I smacked the Cleric Beast around and thought, â€œWow, maybe Iâ€™m good at this!â€ Enter Father Gascoigne who absolutely wrecked me over and over until I accepted my fate as a casual.

Iâ€™ve beaten games that get labeled â€œSouls-likeâ€ - Vampyr, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor - but letâ€™s be real, those are more story-driven adventures with a Souls-like flavor sprinkled on top and not the real punishing deal. Mortal Shell, though? This one actually felt like the real thingâ€¦ but forgiving and beginner-friendly, which was perfect for a newbie like me.

Combat is satisfying but not soul-crushing, â€œhardenâ€ ability is basically a panic button that turns you into a rock (highly relatable), parries and ripostes are satisfying when I donâ€™t completely mess them up, and swapping between four possessed corpses is weirdly fun. Acolyteâ€™s Shell and Smouldering Mace became my comfort picks when I needed to pretend I was good at the game.

Did I git gud? Absolutely not.
Did I feel like I did? Also no.
But now I can smugly say, â€œYeah, I beat a Souls-like,â€ while ignoring the fact that OG Dark Souls and Bloodborne are still lurking in my backlog.

Final Verdict:
If you want to cosplay as a budget Dark Souls player without developing an anger management issue, Mortal Shell is your training wheels.
10/10 would panic-harden again.

user_id:
Only visible to youJC7JenRecommendedBeat78d ago00Only visible to youCanadian_VikingrRecommendedBeat79d ago00Only visible to youThe_Topher89RecommendedBeat712d ago00Only visible to youSandroBalenoRecommended10It did the job of Dark Souls, with innovative new mechanics, a new approach to gameplay, and above all a story that doesn't hide too much and is well written.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Nov 8, 202500Only visible to youMeisterNot RecommendedPaused5Oct 25, 202500Only visible to youChris2801RecommendedBeat8Oct 24, 202500Only visible to youMadhanRajRecommended7Mortal Shell: The perfect souls-lite for n00bs

So, Mortal Shell is officially the first FromSoft-ish Souls-like I didnâ€™t rage-quit halfway through and uninstall out of pure self-loathing. Progress! ğŸ‰

Look, Iâ€™ve tried to join the â€œGit Gudâ€ cult and be That Guy who flexes about finishing Dark Souls and Bloodborne. Reality check:

Dark Souls: Prepare to Die Edition prepared me to die - repeatedly.

Bloodborne convinced me I was ready as I smacked the Cleric Beast around and thought, â€œWow, maybe Iâ€™m good at this!â€ Enter Father Gascoigne who absolutely wrecked me over and over until I accepted my fate as a casual.

Iâ€™ve beaten games that get labeled â€œSouls-likeâ€ - Vampyr, Star Wars Jedi: Fallen Order, and Star Wars Jedi: Survivor - but letâ€™s be real, those are more story-driven adventures with a Souls-like flavor sprinkled on top and not the real punishing deal. Mortal Shell, though? This one actually felt like the real thingâ€¦ but forgiving and beginner-friendly, which was perfect for a newbie like me.

Combat is satisfying but not soul-crushing, â€œhardenâ€ ability is basically a panic button that turns you into a rock (highly relatable), parries and ripostes are satisfying when I donâ€™t completely mess them up, and swapping between four possessed corpses is weirdly fun. Acolyteâ€™s Shell and Smouldering Mace became my comfort picks when I needed to pretend I was good at the game.

Did I git gud? Absolutely not.
Did I feel like I did? Also no.
But now I can smugly say, â€œYeah, I beat a Souls-like,â€ while ignoring the fact that OG Dark Souls and Bloodborne are still lurking in my backlog.

Final Verdict:
If you want to cosplay as a budget Dark Souls player without developing an anger management issue, Mortal Shell is your training wheels.
10/10 would panic-harden again.

jedrc747RecommendedPlaying10Marvel Rivals is a blast to play and I am loving it. It is not a perfect game, it can be pretty visually busy, but there are two reasons besides how fun it is that explain why I am giving it a 10.
1. The love and attention to detail the developers put into it. This is not some rushed-together cash grab. The developers went above and beyond.
2. They are doing free-to-play monetization right. All heroes free and reasonable prices/ways to obtain cool cosmetics.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 9, 202420

GGLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 6, 202420Only visible to youcaptainjace2006RecommendedPaused8I'm addictedLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Dec 6, 202420Only visible to youSpidey-ManNot RecommendedQuit1Marvel Rivals is an absolute dumpster fire of a game and I genuinely regret ever installing this steaming pile of corporate slop.

This is not just bad. It is insultingly bad. A hero shooter backed by the Marvel brand should have been an easy win. Instead they handed us a half baked rage inducing disaster that plays like it was made by a focus group of clowns in a boardroom who have never touched a game in their lives.

Letâ€™s start with the matchmaking. A manipulative engagement based joke that exists solely to keep you on an emotional yo yo feeding you fake wins before slamming you into matches that make you want to smash your monitor. It is not competitive. It is not skill based. It is engineered misery designed to string you along like some dopamine deprived lab rat.

Balance. Nonexistent. Some characters feel like gods. Others like wet tissue paper. You either steamroll or get steamrolled. There is no middle ground no consistency just chaos. And if you solo queue Congratulations. You have entered matchmaking hell where every match is a gamble between getting brain dead teammates or smurfs playing like they are trying to qualify for the Overwatch League.

The combat Floaty clunky and dull. The abilities lack impact. Gunplay feels like crap. Movement is so stiff you might as well be controlling a brick with wifi lag.

It is painfully obvious the devs did not make this game for players. They made it for metrics. For engagement. For retention charts and cash shop conversions. It is not a game. It is a spreadsheet wrapped in Marvel paint and even that cannot cover the stench.

Marvel Rivals is the worst kind of trash The kind that could have been good. It had everything IP power decent visuals potential gameplay variety and they threw it all in the garbage in favor of cheap manipulative systems and half assed design.

I am uninstalling this digital sewage and never looking back. The only rival here is between this game and my gag reflex.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Jun 25, 202510Only visible to youGoonSquadlingRecommendedPlaying8I want to end it. I hope future live services follow in this trend!Mar 5, 202510Only visible to you8qx8vpvfy8Not RecommendedQuit1This review contains spoilers.ShowLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Feb 10, 202510Only visible to youfuryt51499Not RecommendedQuit1Absolutely terribleLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Feb 10, 202510Only visible to youWyattRecommendedPlaying10This is seriously one of the best games that I have played in a while. For 2 DPS  that are fast in speed, they should not have that much health. Either slow them down or give them less health. And the fact that star lord doesn't have the same amount of health i beyond me. And please add better maps. Most people like the more simple mapsLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Feb 4, 202510Only visible to youObbyNot RecommendedBeat6LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Feb 2, 202510Only visible to youCatLeafNot RecommendedQuit6Iâ€™ve been gaslit.Jan 29, 202510Only visible to youCherrycokeloverRecommendedPlaying8I actually love this game so much. I'm not the biggest Marvel fan minus X-men and... that's like it, but I've honestly been having a blast. I main strategist, mainly Mantis or Invisible Woman (Occasionally Luna Snow if we absolutely need it.) Although, I enjoy the game I do have a complaint... the players. Playing Solo Queue in this game is HORRIFIC, in season 0 I couldn't escape bronze. I had so many duelist insta-locks and oh my go... 0 and 8 Starlord, 1 and 1 Spiderman... (He was standing in the corner the entire game until he got his ult.) PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE PLAY THE GAME IF YOU'RE PLAYING IN COMP, I BEG. And if a character isn't working out, it's okay to switch! Not everyone can play DPS, so please, switch if there is only one strategist. ALSO PLEASE DO NOT RUN OFF FROM THE STRATEGISTS AND GO "No heals" or "Where are my heals?" I will not be chasing you when you solo battle to heal you because you will die and I will die... Besides that I love the game! As an ex-OW player it felt refreshing to have a hero pvp that's actually fun, free, and doesn't rely on microtransactions or being lazy. Definitely recommend playing this game with friends, it makes it much easier and tolerable, and to try out other characters instead of one-tricking. :)Jan 27, 202510Only visible to youSpidey4SmashRecommendedBeat9Dec 6, 202410Only visible to youPlayer6606Not RecommendedQuit3record breaking game in my playlist, lowest rating I've given so far and the fastest uninstall, only 90 minutes into the game and I was DONE. PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJames4323RecommendedPaused7Where it seems most games are hardly worth the time to play Lost Ark is the exception.

The writers of lore seem to be initiates into some mysteries. Even some of the fan base, the way they seem to analyze the goings on in Arkesia and Petrania (The worlds of Lost Ark) seem to be of another class.

From the lore, to the soundtrack to the graphics and character design this game excels.

I can hardly believe i took a break for 3-4 months only to play other popular games. To get disconnected every day, multiple times a day. To experience graphics bugs and glitches, UI bugs and glitches each and every day.But this only helped me to realize how poor alot of these other popular games are and how superior Lost Ark is. In fact, if i can recall, i dont think ive been disconnected once on Lost Ark and i dont think ive ever experienced any bugs or glitches.

There is alot going on in this game, the ways to improve your character and abilities can be overwhelming at times and honing can seem next to impossible, even to finish the main story. However it is worth sticking with this game.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Nov 24, 202400Only visible to youAsikaVIRecommendedPlaying10Oct 13, 202500Only visible to youhgfsdghfsdgfNot RecommendedPaused3Sep 20, 202500Only visible to youHasan OzdemirRecommended8Aug 27, 202500Only visible to youCamperTheMLGRecommendedBeat7Jun 9, 202300Only visible to youRobinRecommendedBeat8Jun 20, 202500Only visible to youxThagoRecommendedPaused10May 28, 202500Only visible to youGainwadNot RecommendedQuit4May 12, 202500Only visible to youiLoveAnimeMomsNot RecommendedBeat6May 5, 202500Only visible to youHigginsBurritoRecommendedBeat7Apr 27, 202500Only visible to youSpockWinRecommendedBeat9LOST ARK

To experience graphics bugs and glitches, UI bugs and glitches each and every day.But this only helped me to realize how poor alot of these other popular games are and how superior Lost Ark is. In fact, if i can recall, i dont think ive been disconnected once on Lost Ark and i dont think ive ever experienced any bugs or glitches.

There is alot going on in this game, the ways to improve your character and abilities can be overwhelming at times and honing can seem next to impossible, even to finish the main story. However it is worth sticking with this game.LIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...Nov 24, 202400

PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJazz_games31RecommendedPlaying9It's not the best game I've played but it's the longest I've played among all of the games I ever played time-wise at 8100 hours as of this review. Nothing compared to others but still relatively a long time.
It's an addiction at this point.
I'm just thankful to have a flexible work schedule to be able to play this in between my work but now I just play it moderately and responsibly as to not ruin my time schedule and ultimately my life.
It's highly addictive like how an online game is addictive. 
My wife wanted to learn to play but thank God she got uninterested real quick after she tried and learn how complicated it could get at the start. Don't want her to fall down the rabbit hole. She's better off with her Otome games or visual novels or whatchamacallit.

user_id: PopularScore - HighScore - LowNoneHas TextRecommendedNot RecommendedOnly visible to youJS SollyRecommended8Destiny is a great game, and as a veteran, I have had a love and hate relationship. On the good days, I really enjoyed gaming solo or with friends but on the bad days, I asked myself why I play this game. The campaign, Raids, Dungeons and Exotic Missions by far remain as the best content in the game and probably the best i have ever seen in a game. However for a new comer, the onboarding is pretty rough and the game could get expensive with how much content you have to buy and grind to really catch up. Budgie did introduce some quality of life changes with level scaling for veterans and new comers to play together and make it easier but these changes were implanted too late. It's obvious the higher management making catastrophic decisions has really hindered the game's ability to be a great game such as sunsetting, balance and poor seasonal content that lacked innovation in the past. However it was always meant to be a 10 year old live service game. The darkness and light saga concluded with The Final Shape DLC, which has been the best expansion narratively and graphically with amazing sounds and gameplay but unfortunately undersold due to budgie unable to retain its player population from bad earlier decisions. With all that being said, I do recommend playing it, worth picking it up when it's on sale if you want to get invested.LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleBalanceMore...Aug 26, 202410Only visible to youreal_dong_biwuRecommendedBeat9May 29, 202410Only visible to youMasterAzazel6RecommendedPlaying10It's a game to play without all of the toxic players and just an overall amazing game to playLIKED & DISLIKEDAccessibilityArt StyleMore...May 3, 202410Only visible to youYamanRecommendedBeat77d ago00Only visible to youGC PlaysRecommendedBeat88d ago00Only visible to youStarkiller_RoninRecommendedQuit79d ago00Only visible to youStarcoreRecommendedBeat812d ago00Only visible to youCanadian_VikingrNot RecommendedBeat612d ago00Only visible to youdaifuku_loloRecommendedQuit7Nov 11, 202500Only visible to youbfndytyjwzRecommended8LIKED & DISLIKEDArt StyleCharactersMore...Nov 1, 202500Only visible to youjow_oliverRecommendedBeat7Oct 29, 202500Only visible to youFrak1172RecommendedBeat7Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youAndreAB1991RecommendedBeat10Oct 27, 202500Only visible to youTheMeatyFishmanRecommendedBeat9Oct 26, 202500Only visible to youGrinmatNot RecommendedQuit6Oct 24, 202500Only visible to youGiovanniDSRecommendedPaused7Ci ho giocato in multi con amici peccato che la campagna si puÃ² fare massimo in 3. JuguÃ© la primera entrega de Insurgency y me encantÃ³ por completo. Sus modos de juego, el ritmo, ese equilibrio entre arcade y realismo me parecieron una experiencia Ãºnica dentro de los shooters en primera persona. Insurgency: Sandstorm mantiene ese mismo espÃ­ritu, pero elevando todo a otro nivel. GrÃ¡ficamente es muy superior, el sonido es espectacular cada disparo, cada explosiÃ³n se sienten intensamente reales y la jugabilidad sigue siendo su punto mÃ¡s fuerte.Este no es un shooter para cualquiera. Tiene un enfoque mÃ¡s tÃ¡ctico y realista que Call of Duty, pero no llega a los extremos de simulaciÃ³n de Arma, quedando justo en ese punto medio que lo hace tan especial. Su gunplay es excelente, el arsenal estÃ¡ muy bien trabajado, y los mapas y modos estÃ¡n diseÃ±ados para ofrecer combates intensos, inmersivos y llenos de tensiÃ³n. Si encajas con este estilo de juego, es muy probable que te quedes por decenas o incluso cientos de horas. Y aunque no seas ese jugador â€œidealâ€, Sandstorm sigue ofreciendo razones de sobra para jugarlo, sobre todo si tienes amigos con quienes compartir la **** definitiva, lo recomiendo sin dudar por su jugabilidad, por el realismo bien medido, por sus grÃ¡ficos mejorados y por su sonido impresionante. Un multijugador diferente que merece mÃ¡s atenciÃ³n de la que tiene.

Just like my favorite game of all time L4D2 this game is extremely replayable the community might be toxic to certain people Yes i can see that but I LOVE them I interact with some of the same people here and there and they give me a good laugh. The game gets updates pretty frequently for things like cosmetics, maps, double xp (for account level) it doesn't let the game hang out to dry like what Rockstar games did to Red Dead Redemption 2 MP. The reason i put it as a 9/10 instead of a 10/10 is phasing issues when i shoot someone sometimes the bullet goes through them and hits behind them and there's a weird bug recently I've recently got in the pass few days of ground texture being black but it stops when the game is done, none the less if i had 30 bucks and trying to get an fps that will last me a long time, if im looking for a game that isn't COD, Rainbow 6, and im not looking for a game like ready or not/arma/squad, THIS IS THE GAME!!!
A perfect blend of gritty realism with nice arcadey elements that make for a wonderful serious game, and a wonderful 'lets **** around' game at the same time.

Insurgency: Sandstorm,stands out in the crowded field of first-person shooters with its intense and realistic depiction of modern combat. Launched as the sequel to the original Insurgency, Sandstorm enhances the franchiseâ€™s reputation for delivering gritty, tactical gameplay that rewards teamwork and strategy over lone-wolf **** of the most notable aspects of Insurgency: Sandstorm is its commitment to realism. The game eschews the more arcade-like elements found in many of its peers in favor of a more grounded approach. Weapons behave realistically, with significant recoil and authentic ballistics. This makes gunfights tense and deadly, where a single bullet can be fatal. The sound design further amplifies the immersion, with gunfire and explosions resonating with a visceral, bone-rattling intensity that places players right in the heart of the **** tactical gameplay is another strong point. Insurgency: Sandstorm requires players to communicate and coordinate effectively to succeed. Each match demands careful planning and precise execution, whether youâ€™re capturing objectives, defending positions, or escorting valuable assets. The gameâ€™s various modes, including Push, Firefight, and Checkpoint, offer diverse challenges that test different aspects of tactical proficiency.Visually, Insurgency: Sandstorm may not boast the cutting-edge graphics of some AAA titles, but it compensates with meticulously designed maps that offer a variety of environments, from dense urban centers to sprawling rural landscapes. These maps are not only visually distinct but also intricately designed to support a wide range of tactical approaches.However, Insurgency: Sandstorm is not without its flaws. New players may find the steep learning curve daunting, as the game does little to hold your hand. The realism that hardcore fans love can be a barrier to entry for those accustomed to more forgiving shooters. Additionally, while the game has seen numerous updates and content additions, it still suffers from occasional bugs and performance issues that can detract from the overall experience.Despite these drawbacks, Insurgency: Sandstorm offers a refreshing alternative to more mainstream shooters. Its emphasis on realism and tactical gameplay creates a uniquely intense experience that stands out in the genre. For players who crave a challenging and authentic depiction of modern combat, Insurgency: Sandstorm is a compelling choice that rewards patience, precision, and teamwork.
It just feels like a copy and past of other fps games ive played. It doesn't stand out i and is just another multiplayer fps game. Its pretty good, but just nothing special.ndependently
really great game. I like the realism, especially shotguns. not that many games get it right. good comms with teammates.

Love the realism and attention to detail in graphics, animations, and mechanics! Although I like it being sort of an arcade game, the optimization does ruin the gameplay but the game is fun generally.
best arcade and sim shooter to this day

The performance eventually became stable by 2022. Overall, they found a balance between hardcore simulators and arcade fun. All weapons are available from the first level, but it takes time to find your most suitable options and set of mods. The death is a matter of a couple of hits or one headshot, but it will not be easy to land those shots. Updates are relatively rare, but there are funky game modes in rotation that change every two weeks.

A way more strategical take on the COD / BF / CS formula. The time to kill is extremely low making any weapon viable and making the game more about strategy and reflexes. Sadly there is no real progression system. Due to that many players quit and the player number are rather low.

Absolutely do not recommend this game. Because it has two useless classes - the Observer, who is always running wherever and does not fulfill his functions and the Commander, who can do nothing because he is FULLY dependent on the Observer, who is running wherever!

It was a good game with good gunfight and has bot to play offline which very hard to find now a day. However after Devs decide to improve enemy bots and make it a terminator with aimbot at every range game become frustrate to play in local play

Compared to most modern shooters its decent but the slow pacing and unusable explosives ruin the game for hardcore players.

The game is absolute dogs**t. You wait more to respawn than that you actually play the game. All the game modes are also terrible. Would refund immediately if I could.

Not able to review this for PS4 so I will drag the PC score down until I can: this game has been out 3 years on PC, itâ€™s become quite apparent that PC footage was used to sell the PS4 version as the PS4 Day one version in no way looks like or has the fidelity of the PC version. Itâ€™s a stuttering, Tearing un optimized mess on day one, a new developer I would give a by ball but this is a 3 year old game and it looks and runs like a PS2 game with the graphics of MGS 1. Lets run down the list of issues this scummy developer thought they would get away with: No Hit Detector, No Kill Detector, A weird marker for friendlyâ€™s that appears to the side of them and at some distance from them, a broken comms system where enemy conversations can be heard, screen tearing, lack of any anti-aliasing, Lack of HD graphics, this things running in standard def, lack of textures, broken load out system that fails to remember saved load outs, Lack of progress markers, lack of round information, lack of scoring system, an extremely low draw distance, a gutted game mode system, no vehicles, pop in everywhere, lack of 60fps (in an FPS of all things) a mess of a menu system, a diabolical weapon modification system that remembers nothing, a class system thatâ€™s all over the place with standard sniper, heavy, light and assault classes all behind paywalls. And the most important part the bullet physics, I understand the game is built around this but with the exceptionally low graphics there is simply no point to it, I cannot see the drop to correct the shot through the tearing and jaggy choppy gameplay. A f*cking disgrace of a day one release after 3 years to polish. Its no wonder medicritic has reviews switched off on the PS4 and Xbox versions. Well letâ€™s hope users who canâ€™t review it over there come here and drag the PC score down with this sinking ship cause these scum donâ€™t deserve to get away with this at Â£59.99â€¦ (DO NOT BUY ON CONSOLE! Sooooooooooo after waiting 6 months waiting for an update and optimization for the game, DEV's launched 1.6 test version which includes 1 mediocre map and 2 new guns that have an excesive stupid recoil and added it to the advisor class removing the SVD and EBR MK14 that were the most used guns by players on that class.

They also added the most stupid feature called DEATHCAM which is total trash because now you can see from where you got shot from and all the enemies on that area, meaning that the tactical part of the game is lost.

Once again after hundreds of complaints about that stupid feature they are still going to implement it on the stable version which demonstrate that they don't give a **** about their community feedback and they will still do whatever they want.

So my question is...what is the point of asking feedback when DEV's really don't care about your opinion unless you kiss their a$$es with every stupid decision they make.

Just to make a quick summary of what you will be getting by buying this game is:

- 0 optimization (optimization for this DEV's means, removing stuff from the maps)
- Updates every 6 months which are just gonna be trash.
- Hit Reg issues
- Abandoned Server Owners (Meaning no new cvars, no server side optimization)
- Terrible Hit Reg
- Unknown Performance(The game can run amazingly well on a top tier PC ro it can run like trash on the same PC)
- Fed Up Community (Tired of all the **** of the game and DEV's that got stucked with a facked up game without the option to refund it)

So if you are willing to go through all of that then buy it, if not then save your money and wait for some amazing titles being launched this year.

However, there are also frequent bugs â€” some funny, like enemies dying and suddenly flying off into the sky, and others less amusing, like game crashes or your character getting randomly launched across the map with all their ****â€™s perfectly playable solo, but I think the experience is much more enjoyable with friends.

What started as one of the most fun experiences of the modern gaming generation was stunted by a former dev team that doubled down on their questionable decisions. Now heralded by a dev  team that appears to prioritize enjoyment and game feel, the game is back to what it was at the start. Mindless fun that you could log into for a couple of hours and enjoy with friends. The movement sometimes clunky, the bugs infuriating, and the friendly fire always hilarious. If you're a fan of action multiplayer games that are PVE(or PVP depending on how your allies are feeling), then this game is one you shouldn't miss.

Helldivers 2 is a masterpiece in the action and cooperative shooter genre, bringing the gaming experience to a new generation with its stunning blend of strategy, teamwork, and adrenaline. The community is active, and there are always teammates ready to fight by your side. Moreover, the extensive character customisation and progression options provide excellent motivation to keep playing and improving. In short, it's a cracking gameâ€”the kind that only comes around every 15 or 20 years.

This game is full of bugs and crashes. The balancing update is really funny. But overall, it's gameplay is fundamentally great.

One of the greatest games in the roguelike genre. On par with such giants as Hades, TBoI and Dead Cells. The music is excellent and suits the game very well, the visuals are pleasant and understandable, the plot is a bit weak, but not bad at all, the replayability is cosmic, and the variety is huge. An amazing game. I understand those people who have more than 500 hours, 1k hours and more in it. The game is 5 years old since its release, and I still enjoy coming back to it. The community of this game has not disappointed either. They make funny memes and excellent mods with guides. What more could you want from dedicated fans? In co-op, the game reveals its full potential.

An absolute game masterpiece. Despite some minor conflicts, like regarding early seekers of the storm DLC, it is still a masterpiece. Lore is tragic and well-made, secrets are secret enough and game is actually challenging. So I would recommend it to anyone. Literally.

I blew 10 hours into Risk of Rain 2. I couldn't get past through Mithrix **** this playthrough made me appreciate this game a whole lot more.

I was never too impressed with the game's presentation. I think i just needed more time to get comfortable with the game's general direction. It's not the most visually interesting game I've played, but at least the character design, enemy designs, level design, and colour grading all comes together to deliver a solid package of a visual style. I want to emphasis on the enemy designs here. Their designs are what sold me to the game's visual direction. The larger creatures has a certain aesthetic to them that compliments the background setting a lot.

I was also mixed on the music for a good while. I don't dislike them or anything, but i think i got very overwhelmed by the game's stimuli. The default settings for this game's audio was really loud and it made me uncomfortable. It's not until i turned down the volume until i could appreciate the game's audio design. The soundtrack elevates the hectic and chaotic battle sequences at least 10 times. Of course, this is only possible if the sound effects were good in the first place, and they are! the sound designs has so much weight to it. It really sells you the scale of the larger enemies in the game. Sound clues are also very effective here. A lot of sounds are exclusive to a certain type of threat. So a headphone/earphone is recommended to get the full experience.

This game's mechanics is the spotlight here. Risk of Rain 2 is a 3D Third person shooter game, and it uses that concept until the point of exhaustion. It's a philosophy that's very integral for any type of Art. You thought of a concept? use it over and over again until you couldn't think of anything more. Some of the most memorable enemies for me are the airborn ones! That's a serious feat in my opinion. And some of the on-ground enemies could jump/float! just to mess with your sense of vision. This game's battle sequences are extremely hectic and chaotic. This experience is probably what made me uncomfortable about the game for a good while. So many things could happen in a blink of an eye! the stimuli is insane.

Another thing about RoR 2's mechanics I've seen being brought up by the community is the Rogue-like implementation. Other Rogue-like video games won't allow you to have too many abilities in a single run, just because they don't want you to be too powerful. Like Hades, Inscryption, and Buckshot Roulette, just to name a few. Risk of Rain 2 is perfectly fine with you stacking up so many insane power ups on top of the external helps (Drones, Turrets, Guardians etc.). RoR 2 allows the player to feel like an absolute monster. How did the game balance this mechanic? The final boss could steal your items and abilities. You get them back by dealing damage at the bastard. Insane video game. The game's battle system oozes so much polish and care behind it. I couldn't help but feel inclined to boot up RoR 2 day after day just to experience it again. Risk of Rain 2 is a very fresh experience in the Rogue-like space. Not necessarily the absolute king of the genre, but a unique exprience nonetheless.

This recent playthrough made me see Risk of Rain 2 in a whole new light. A very complex and nuanced 10/10.I'll keep playing this game over and over again until i defeat that bastard Mithrix...

Inicialmente, Risk of Rain 2 me gustÃ³ mucho, pero a medida que fueron pasando las horas rÃ¡pidamente se fue transformando cada vez mÃ¡s en aburrimiento. Las razones hablarÃ© de ellas ahora, pero quiero que quede claro que lo juguÃ© en solitario, con lo que probablemente las sensaciones y eso para quienes lo jueguen en multiplayer con amigos (como estÃ¡ diseÃ±ado) sean mejores. Si resumimos mucho, el juego es un shooter rogue-like, con mogollÃ³n de enemigos, cada vez mÃ¡s y mÃ¡s duros, en lo que explorar zonas para conseguir mejoras aleatorias y desbloquear el teleportador previa batalla contra el boss. El problema es que se hace muy repetitivo porque le faltan cosas tÃ­picas de los roguelike. Una de esas cosas es que los mapas aquÃ­ son fijos (con variaciones menores como zonas pequeÃ±as que pueden estar accesibles o no), con lo cual se acaba conociendo los mismos demasiado, si ademÃ¡s tenemos en cuenta que los primeros los ves todo el rato, se acaba haciendo muy repetitivo. Luego le falta una historia asÃ­ como un sistema de progresiÃ³n de cualquier clase que otorgue objetivos o razones para jugar, pero en este caso cada intento es completamente independiente. El Ãºnico cambio que queda de una partida a otra es lo que vas desbloqueando, que se hace en base a conseguir logros, algunos de los cuales ocurrirÃ¡n simplemente por ir jugando, pero la mayorÃ­a acaban dependiendo del azar de que te caigan los bonos adecuados, de que una habilidad ocurra de cierto modo, etc. lo cual acaba siendo muy frustrante. Igual que lo es el hecho de que, llegado cierto punto y con una build decente, al final el juego se resume en "te vas cargando todo sin que te hagan nada hasta que llegas al lugar equivocado y sin que puedas evitarlo, de una hostia te bajan entero". GrÃ¡ficamente el juego tiene una estÃ©tica muy suya pero personalmente no me ha gustado nada,  y tiene ademÃ¡s ciertos problemas de legibilidad en la distancia (como que los cadÃ¡veres de ciertos enemigos parecen cofres). La mÃºsica ahÃ­ ya es cosa de gustos, para mi es demasiado electrÃ³nica noventera, que es un gÃ©nero que no me convence, pero ahÃ­ habrÃ¡ a quien si le parezca perfecta y sin duda, no puedo decir que sea mala pese a que no encaje en mis gustos. No hay voces como tales, los efectos de sonido son muy bÃ¡sicos. Y el juego tiene ciertos bugs ocasionales como cosas que spawnean dentro de paredes, una baja IA de enemigos y aliados, **** todo ello, Risk of Rain no me parece un juego terrible, pero tampoco gran cosa. Y acaba repitiÃ©ndose como una cena que te sienta pesada. Un 4.

Pros: Intense atmosphere - Realistic gunplay - Teamwork is crucialCons: Steep learning curve - Outdated visuals - Not newbie-friendly Rising Storm 2: Vietnam stands out among war games with its emphasis on realism and tactical depth. Itâ€™s not the most accessible title, but once mastered, it offers a deeply satisfying and immersive experience. The game captures the chaos of the Vietnam War with great authenticityâ€”from the crack of gunfire to the intensity of large-scale firefights. Teamwork is absolutely crucial, as success depends more on coordination than individual skill. While its dated visuals and steep difficulty may deter newcomers, players who enjoy a strategic and 
realistic FPS will find RS2 Vietnam to be a uniquely rewarding experience.

This game is really fantastic. It's the game Battlefield wants to be.

It's tough and will kick your ass, but it's such a blast to play. It's not perfect. The game never feels "stable," and stuff like ping is constantly all over the place across the board. But it doesn't really detract from the experience too much.  It's really a good time.

There are some aspects that aren't ideal. The community is pretty toxic at times, but it's not something that plagues the entire player base. There are also a lot of classes where you will not be able to play 99% of the time. A lot of the classes can only have a certain amount of people select it at once, and it's based on a mostly first come, first serve basis around how quickly you load into the game. If you don't have the best SSD & setup, prepare to play rifleman and whatnot most of the time. Even then, it's still great fun.

This is hands down the best FPS game released since Battlefield 2142 (Maybe Battlefield 3 at a push).  A game for the proper Gamer, where a modern Call of Duty approach of 'Spray & Pray' will be met with a swift bullet to the head at 50meters!

If you are considering purchasing and are exacerbated by the ever reducing quality and dumbing down of games (CoD, Battlefield 4, V etc..) then please give this a shot!  The realism is top notch and the mechanics are very balanced.  Yes it is challenging, but it makes it all more the satisfying when you manage to get a kill on the other team!

Solid all around shooter, very fun to play online in large scale battles.  A great representation of the Vietnam war.  Team work is key, had a blast playing online with friends several hours of fun and frustration.  Great online shooter with a multiplayer campaign mode, large selection of classes, weapons, and tools.

Pretty solid graphics and mechanics, def a must buy fr anyone that like large scale open battles with multiple objectives.
Pretty fun shooter to just pop in and play for an hour or so. Fairly cheap, too. Good if you're looking for something slightly more tactical than CoD or just a Vietnam game

The gameplay itself is not that bad... but the developers made very dumb choices regarding the game. For example the cartoonish style of the characters (yet it's supposed to be a game where it feels like real war) , only few maps are actually good and therefore played by the users while the other maps are basically never voted (at the end of the match the players must vote for a map). For some reason, the developers implemented the possibility to chat with the enemy team... without being able to mute users tho, so far too often you will encounter toxic users on the enemy team who spams insults ruining the game experience. Shame as it could have been far better.

This review is based on experience playing RS2:V after EGA giveaway. If you grab game for free this might help you decide is it worth actually downloading.

It's my first realistic MMOFPS, I enjoyed it so much at first, I'd made a little research through guides and game history, and now ready to present my opinion.

IF IT WAS 2017, I'D RATE GAME 8 OR 9 OUT OF 10. BUT THERE ARE TO MANY "BUTS" NOW. As you could've guessed, FOR SHORT VERSION READ ONLY CAPS from now on.

GAME IS BASICALLY ABANDONED BY DEVELOPERS. That's it. It was free giveaway because company no longer interested in the game. Original developer team is long gone and had to be recontacted to do EGS-transfer and troubleshooting.
There is stuff just cut out from the game. It's three maps and M16A2. Game realistically doesn't have over 9000 guns, so it's really important. There are some balancing issues never to be resolved (Long Tan map for example). No event support at all (like Halloween). Graphics are just bad. No bulletholes on surfaces, you can't zero your gun properly while training. No internal guides, just two training areas, one of which being actual map, no ability to train with bots there. There are nasty bugs, I'd seen on 2017 videos and even 2015 CBT footages. Going prone and standing up can result in your legs being under the ground and you will limp excessively. In this condition, moving prone is the fastest way. If your helicopter crashed, you survived and some ally is near by, it mostly results in autokick from server for excessive team damage. There are of course some smaller bugs, but these two are the biggest pain.

CONTENT CREATORS ARE GONE. Basically no channels. Old guides with obsolete information. Placeholders, work-in-proogress, no longer supported everywhere.

PING IS HELL. Don't believe ping value of server in search. Multiply by at least 3, be ready for x4, expect x5. And magically 20 ping becomes 100. Sometimes, when we're losing, I check ping values of players. Losing team has higher values.

TO GET FULL GAME PAY EXTRA ~50$ MONTHLY. There are 2 types of servers. Official and private. Private costs money. You can't just create a room with setting, no-no, pay to third party. Official servers have some of only two game modes: Territory (capture the objective) and Supremacy (capture and hold for points). If you want to play Skirmish (team deathmatch), Campaign (consequent battles with its own rules) or Green Army Man DLC as Free Grunt (Territory and Supremacy) you have two options: go for someone's server hope for the best (ping, rules, community, quantity of players) or buy one for yourself and hope for the same best. Same applies for different settings (called mutators), like visibility of allied troops marks, making game more realistic.

GAMING COMMUNITY ****.
You get new players, that don't want to learn, grab most important classes, and try to play RS2V as generic MMOFPS, aiming for good K/D ratio, that they will never get, and not playing the objective.
On the other hand you have salty people that send anyone to training areas to learn to fly, for example. Well, it's really easy with 0 ms ping and when no one is firing at you.
Again, on some other hand you have kickers. They want your class just because. Or don't like you. Most notorious one changed team and kicked me. Why others agreed? I suppose, they thought "if votekick is going, it's definitely for a reason". So, I ask you, if you'll play, never votekick if you don't know the crime.
Just bad commanders.
Radiomen not sticking to commander and actually picking up this class just because it's a class. They don't even use the smokes.
Macrosusers atop this cake to definitely ruin your day.

Rising storm 2 is one of the best, while one of the worst multiplayer games I've ever played!

Combat, gameplay, pace, maps, guns, sound, and Community are awsome.

Servers, Graphics, and animation ****!

Gameplay-
Its just divine, you feel like you are really in the war, and you can't just run for the objective, you need to be careful, cooperate with your teammates.
The shots feel real, and every decision you make will have an impact (good or bad).
The community always tries to help and is respectful.

Now the bad points:

Graphics and animations-
They look kinda bad and outdated, even for a 2017 game, I mean, its unreal engine 3 and there are a lot of visual bugs.

Servers-
Now, this is THE big problem:
The worst servers I've seen in my entire life (including MW)... The game is free right now, and 20k people are playing the game, but it cant handle such amount of people! my question is: if they cant handle 20k players, why is it free? I mean, it is just a dumb move, and no one will want to return to the game, and it will die AGAIN...
I can't find servers and the servers that are not full have 200 ping.
Everyone complaining about how poorly made the game is...
AND THE **** MENU AND SETTINGS LITTRELAY BROKE I CAN'T MAKE SOUND LOWER AND THE BROWSER SISTEM JUST STOPS WORKING SOMETIMES (2000 GAMES PROBLEMS)

3/10 (i hope ALL of this gets better after everyone stops playing)

had some pretty bad first time experience. this game is almost unplayable for me. I7 and a 1080TI and yet finding servers to hold a framerate is a major problem...

Awful, probably the worst shooter I've ever played.
The whole experience - get killed over and over in one shot when you have no idea where the fire is coming from as everything looks like a blobby green mess.

I've got no problem with unforgiving games, but this game gives you literally nothing. There's a really steep learning curve, and really no reason to do it. The gameplay isn't unique. The maps are boring and straight up poorly designed, and the hitboxes and general controls just feel sloppy. If you like it, you like it, but there are many objectively better shooters out. It's just not fun.
Critical bugs are killing the game: 'Connection to the server has been lost' unranked bug, and when dying the Dshk weapons disappear. Needs another big patch from the devs.

Very generic, mediocre shooter that is saved by its Green Army Man mode. Otherwise avoid this. It's buggy, the community of this game is toxic (not in just a gameplay either.. ran into so many bigots in this game... [is the game even being moderated at all????!?!??]), and the regular MP/campaign modes really just ****.

--Got This With My Humble Monthly Subscription--

Post void is a very very fun, very fast-paced FPS arcade ish game. Short but really fun and gets intense on the later levels. Now is one of my games that I love to pick up and blast through some deranged looking enemies with an uzi that bounces off the wall and explodes in impact, what a game. I love pew pew shoot things 7.7/10
For only being about $3 this game is great! Very fast paced and really cool visuals. My favourite thing about this game is the art style. It's a very short game but priced accordingly.

awesome and game!!! super adrenaline, lysergic and pulp with an exceptional art style and gunplay and a really raw, dirty rock&roll soundtrack... to be accompanied by some Guitar Wolf listening...LOVE IT!!!
the time is POST VOID the place is POST VOID and this game its pretty insane

The game is extremely fun and addictive with great replayability and a clear goal in mind but even with this in mind I do wish there was more diversity between runs being more types of upgrades between levels and different weapons. Even so this game is great with out them and is one of the best things you can do with $5 (Australian)
Post Void succeeds in being one of the most pulse pounding and hectic games I've ever played. Good

This game - is a true work of art!
Although it is a banal shooting range for speed,
But, the music makes this experience unforgettable and infinitely replayable, I respect the composer, this "inducing" motive, which, after passing the middle of the game, becomes generally mad - it's incredible.
The plot here, most likely, is about a drug addict who is trying not to die and get out of the "binge", and, of course, there is not enough full-fledged story up to 10/10, but you can imagine any story convenient for you in your head, where the main character needs to run until the end and not die. Another flaw of the game for me is not very well-developed shooting, I completed game with a shotgun, it's much easier, but the "aim-challenge" is losted.
Well, I can also say that sometimes quite beautiful locations are generated, all the sounds are of high quality.
And yet, the game is quite easy, in fact, it takes 4-7 hours to complete, even if you donâ€™t know how to shoot (again, shotgun helps you), lacks some kind of hardcore mode, but it would be even better to get the second part)

Probably the best way to spent your 2 Dollars( dont eat that twix bar you pig buy this game instead) Fast paced  shooting with some grotesque enemies and hard as **** gameplay awww yeaah

[POST VOID] is a fantastic yet ultimately too short FPS experience.

I would highly recommend [POST VOID] yet it will definitely leave you wanting more.

Gritty, raw, and unforgiving. Post Void is a perfect example of art direction and gameplay meeting abrasively (in the best way) to create a unique and whole experience. Better move at a break-neck speed and hit shots with pinpoint accuracy or you'll never reach the end. This was the most fun I've had playing a game in a long time, can't recommend enough.
This is a very addictive fast pace game and the art style looks like you just took acid

Turbo Overkill is an excellent game that doesn't shy away from sending dopamine directly to your brain, I surprised myself playing the game Over and Over again without really thinking about it. The weapon roaster is extremely enjoyable to shoot and gibbing the enemies is music to my ears. Overall it's a more than competent game and Civvie should play Part 2.

GOOD SIDE
-Comfortable character control and fast fighting system.
-A story that does not take itself seriously is an aspect that makes me happy.
-Boss battles are good.
-Level design diversifies and develops in later sections.
-You can shape your play style with the new cybernetic and weapon modes that open.
-Beautiful music.

BAD SIDE
-Level design is shallow at the beginning.
-The feeling of hitting is weak.
-Some weapons are both weak and meaningless.
-The visuals sometimes hurt your eyes.

According to 2025
This game is like low budget doom. I liked it but after a while it gets repetitive and boring.

Hits hard, with killer gameplay and legit boomer shooter gunplay that reminds me of what the genre is all about. I don't play these games for the story or the visuals - I play them for the fun factor, and Turbo Overkill (for the most part...) excels.
Episode 1: 10/10
Episode 2: 7/10
Episode 3: 3/10
Might just be an example of too much being a bad thing, but by the time I hit ep3 I was kinda over it. Levels are all a bit long and my god these final boss fights are rough, with punishing lack of checkpoints etc. Still I'd say the fights are fun as hell, with all the movement tech the game provides coupled with furious guns blazing. Worth a play. Just be prepared to wonder how long the ride is going to last.

Oh and why the fk is there a sniper in a retro shooter? And why in the fk are there multiple segments dedicated to it?

Uff, es un juego increÃ­ble.Tiene una historia minimalista, pero llena de personajes y de humor. El combate es extremadamente satisfactorio, tienes una serie de diversas armas para diferentes situaciones y con distintas habilidades que mejoras mientras juegas. TambiÃ©n obtienes distintos elementos de tu equipo que te ayuda en la movilidad, asÃ­ como en el **** diseÃ±o de niveles es excelente en su mayorÃ­a, hay uno que otro nivel que puede durar un poco mÃ¡s tiempo del que uno quiere y despÃºes hay otros que intentan diversificar las cosas aÃ±adiendo vehiculos y cosas asÃ­; algunos de estos ultimos funcionan bien, otros -en mi opiniÃ³n-, no **** grafÃ­cas son bastante particulares, mezclan entre sprites, asÃ­ como arte en tercera dimensiÃ³n, eso sin contar lo bueno que es la banda sonora.AdemÃ¡s, el juego tiene muchos secretos, modos de juegos extra, distintos trucos que uno puede desbloquear por medio de secretos, asÃ­ como la habilidad de siempre poder volver a jugar cualquier nivel manteniendo su progreso; tiene un sistema universal de desbloqueo, entonces uno puede jugar el primer nivel con todas las armas y mejoras del ultimo, por ejemplo. I have not finished this game but I just really felt I had to say a few things about it.This is one of the greatest examples of what a small new studio with a brand new IP and a very limited budget can do when time and opportunity is given to people with incredible talent and video game design understanding. I have played so many shooters from huge AAA titles to AA to indies and truly very few can come even close to how this game is managing to capture the old school boomer shooter aesthetic while at the same time looking super modern and have amazing graphics. The combat is just so fast, so satisfying with some of the most spot on sound design and fps mechanics I've ever experienced.
It is the most fun I've had in a very long time plain and simple nothing more to it.

Really fun boomer shooter, where every weapon is fun to shoot, the enemies are varied enough to be interesting and the arena levels are okay. Level design is very poor, sadly, with unclear directions and it' frequently difficult to understand what the game wants from you. The ammo and health distribution is also an issue, there is no reliable way to get these from the enemies, unless they are fodder enemies. So it's not quite Doom Eternal level combat and some opponents fall into the bullet sponge category, but that's a small issue, since the game provides really fun weapons to engage with them.
Amazing retro style FPS. Hadn't had a fill of adrenaline like this since I finished Doom Eternal. Super recommended game!
Turbo Overkill AKA Chainsaw Man The Game 10/10.

Haven't had this much fun since ULTRAKILL and DOOM Eternal. The game looks amazing despite it's pixelated models, and the gunplay feels amazingly fun. When people say "Chainsaw Man", the first thing that comes to mind is Turbo Overkill.

Great world-building. Fantastic music. Creative level design. They nailed the feel of bouncing around in games like Quake, and built a genuinely creepy and fun game around it. 

My main complaint is that some weapons are objectively much better than others, so as things get harder you pretty quickly get forced into using the same couple of weapons while ignoring the rest. The games of this genre that I've enjoyed the most have revolved around switching between well-balanced weapons to take advantage of their various strengths, but that aspect just isn't here. 

Still a great game.
One of the best boomer shooters of nowadays. Some levels have pretty meh level design, but that's it!

After a little over 3 hours on DUSK, with having finished the first episode; I could confirm this game is incredible. The presentation is on point! The sound design, the soundtrack, the colour grading and general art style sells you the game's rural horror lovecraftian-ish **** combat design too are amazing. It took everything that made Quake worked and made it it's own thing! From the non-linear level design as well as the enemy boss fight **** easy 10/10 from me. An amazing addition to my gaming library, and a must-play for any fan of Boomer shooters.
Good boomer shooter. A little simple gameplay wise but it has a really cool horror flavor

The atmosphere, gameplay, soundtrack, level design, sound design, visuals, and everything else is top-tier.
I'd argue it's the second best game of all time, right behind Elden Ring.
Having grown up on some of the OG FPS' like Duke Nukem and Unreal, this is a blast to play.

It's a cool game.
Pros.:
- Old-school vibe and aesthetics.
- References to Quake (first one) and Blood.
- Creative levels. Especially in Episode 3.
- Plenty of secrets.

Cons.:
- IDK. Most of the things are cool. Music is fine. Probably, sounds are too primitive sometimes.
really good retro movment shooter the soundtrack is great

Great boomer shooter. Big variety of weapons, memorable enemies and levels. This is clearly a work of passion and talent, everything pieces together perfectly. If you feel like you might like it from the trailer you will most definitely love it, it's pretty straight forward. 

I had to cut one point because there are parts of the game that didn't click for me. Sometimes I got lost in the level and wasn't sure how to progress, but not for long fortunately. The flipping mechanic is very confusing with the perspective change on the camera. There were also certain spots where the enemies would get stuck, but not too many. 

These are all just nitpicks. This game is absolutely gorgeous.

This is a game that has to be played to understand why the reviews are so high. I watched videos and thought it looked neat, but it wasnâ€™t really pulling me in. It sat in my library for over a year, and within 5 minutes of experiencing it, I understood. A couple days later, I finished the game, and what a wonderful treat for people who grew up with the original Quake. This game seriously captures the same energy of Quake without making the formula feel in any way dated. The gameplay is very simple, but itâ€™s a nice refreshing throwback to when games required the fast paced run and gun movement rather than relying on cover. Where I think the game really shines is the atmosphere - who would have ever thought that this game with its intentionally retro graphics and play style would have a creepier atmosphere than many modern horror games. The initial part of the game gave me the atmospheric feeling of Resident Evil 4, except better. Some of the later sections of the game are truly unsettling. Between the beautiful yet extremely simple graphics and the phenomenal sound design, it helps tell the story of the game without the game actually having much of an overt story at all. Everything is told through the atmosphere and level design. It was actually pretty fun guessing what was going on and trying to create a story for yourself, since there is hardly any written or spoken dialogue. The sound design in this game is fantastic, a master in its class and it outsides most major modern horror games - especially some of the settings in the later portions of the game. Itâ€™s a pretty challenging game, but its highly rewarding. While it got frustrating at times, the satisfaction of pushing through a level and completing it after multiple tries was something I rarely experience in games anymore. The only flaw I would say is regarding some of the level design, which is true to the classic genre, but it didnâ€™t age the best. I found myself lost pretty regularly because a lot of the textures and buildings look the same. Sometimes it allowed for some fun exploration, other times I was just running around for several minutes unable to figure out where I last saw something. There are a few really dark levels that were particularly irritating because of how difficult it was to find your way around. Overall, this is an excellent game that I think fans of the classics and modern shooter fans can both enjoy all the same. Everything this game sets out to do it excels at.

Incredible indie game, it has a high resemblance to DOOM, even the keys, red, yellow and blue are present. I love the originality of this game! Engaging and haunting soundtrack, horror/horror game is only really good when it has these 90s graphics, I also love the amount of bodies that are on the ground, the violence, an almost perfect game!
Retro FPS style is nice, but clunky controls, repetitive combat, and lack of innovation make it feel outdated and dull

Overall a very fun, unique and interesting experience. The world of S#*t city is pungent, and fits exceptionally well with its art style (both in game and within the intro cutscene and accompanying art), atmosphere, tone and, best of all, the soundtrack. 
Gameplay is engaging. As you progress and complete challenges within missions, you acquire a new pair of trainers which give you modifiers which range from a second life, explosions when you kick doors, giving enemies big heads, etc. It bodes well for replayability. The game at its core isnâ€™t so challenging, but when going for the challenge stars, it makes the game a lot more difficult. 

The thing I like the most about this game is the artstyle, music, atmosphere and setting, I think it all fits together exceptionally well, and gives a breath of fresh air to the genre. A unique experience, and something that will stay in my mind for a while. Highly recommend if you enjoy underground counterculture, pungent violence, somewhat challenging gameplay, and rave music

This game reminds me a lot of the Ghostrunner series where it's definitely a first person shooter/melee game but it's less about just shooting your way through levels and more about being precise. Feels more like a puzzle game to an extent than just a straightforward shooter. Definitely a game where it's all about trial and error and you will absolutely have to play a level multiple times to get your run down perfect. A little frustrating because of this and because it feels like a grind and I constantly feel like even if I am doing well I could get killed going through a new doorway and have to restart the whole level all over again. The music is great and it is kind of a ridiculous concept of the world run by gangs and you being the one guy who's not in a gang. Gameplay is super solid though which is bringing me back into it for sure. The random driving mechanics they threw in to the last two levels of the game totally threw me off and they were not intuitively controlled at all and that dropped the score for me because a solid shooter became a janky Drive Fest in the very last stretch of the game.
Very fun game. Very punishing and hard as well, but still very unique. Can Recommend!!!!

(MY SCORE : 7.9 /10) Fast-Paced Action Game that is exciting and quite challenging! Combat in this game, apart from Shooters using Pistols or Guns with limited ammunition, we can also rely on kicks with Feet which we can wear with Shoes or Sandals, which we can unlock with the number of Stars we get in each Stage. There are 5 areas that must be passed on the **** City Map to complete this game, including: The Violence Gang (15 Stage + Boss), The Pollution Gang (13 Stage + Boss), The Business Gang (15 Stage + Boss), The Debauchery Gang (13 Stages + Boss), Crime Tower (4 Stages + Boss). LIST OF BOSS I Faced: Goocopkopter / Goocopbomber / 1997 Lucida. The Sludge Baron / The Unflushable / The Filth Mind. The Ceo / Mega Ceo / Mecha Ceo. Pizza Pig / Unholy Corpulence / Spider Pig. The Crime Minister. There are 2 endings in this game, namely Bad and True Ending. Bad Ending if we choose to accept The Crime Minister's offer to join and enjoy Nice City by kicking Premium Sneakers into the fire. Or choose Premium Sneakers and kick The Crime Minister! (True Ending).

Do you like Doom or Doom Eternal ?

I can't believe I wasted my time on this. Superhot is a total letdown. The "time moves when you move" mechanic gets old so fast, and the gameplay becomes a repetitive slog. The story is non-existent, the graphics are painfully dull, and thereâ€™s nothing here to keep you engaged for more than an hour. This game is overrated, and I canâ€™t understand why anyone would recommend it. If youâ€™re thinking about buying it, save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere. 2/10.

First off, let me just say that this game is a ******* nightmare. The whole concept of time only moving when you do sounds intriguing on paper, but in execution, it's just a headache-inducing mess. Trying to strategize and plan your moves while everything is frozen in place is enough to make anyone want to pull their hair out. And don't even get me started on those damn red men. They pop up out of nowhere, relentless in their pursuit to take you down. It felt like no matter what I did, they were always one step ahead, ready to dish out another frustrating defeat. In conclusion, "superhot" is a frustrating, infuriating mess **** that I would not recommend to my worst enemy. Save yourself the headache and the rage-inducing moments, and spend your time playing something actually enjoyable. Trust me, you'll thank me later.

Legends of Runeterra is a brilliantly designed online trading card game. Most importantly, LoR innovates game mechanics with a back-and-forth format that objectively make this game more tactical (but maybe less beginner-friendly) than its peers (like Hearthstone). With most actions that a player takes, the opponent has an option to respond, which often results in chains of actions with sometimes incredible comebacks/upsets. The artwork and animations are stellar, and the universe the game takes place in is advantaged by a rich legacy lore due to the producer's other products like League of Legends and Arcane. The game offers an incredible and near-endless PvE experience in addition to PvP: in fact, PvP has sadly taken a back-seat in the last couple years but is by no means dead as matches only take minutes to find. The future is difficult to predict and I hope that PvP will grow more as my heart will always be in PvP gameplay. Perhaps the most admirable quality of this game is its refusal to be "pay-to-win" as free cards and resources are given generously and consistently so that any player looking to play competitively can do so free of financial cost if they desire, at least for PvP. And that is something Hearthstone cannot boast.

A big problem I had was the card picking. Depending on your starting hand, and how you play it, will the computer "choose" the cards you pick up in your deck, I find in most cases. So at that point, it's only strategic for like, the first 25% of the round, and the next 5 - 7 mins is just the computer stalling to make the game longer, REGARDLESS of whether you are winning or losing. I felt this isn't an ACTUAL card game because you don't get your cards by chance, but the cards you pick up are heavily influenced by the (winning/losing) stance you are in (Losing = **** cards each round, winning = Stronger cards each round), The probability of getting certain cards is sealed depending on whether you are winning or losing, unlike REAL card games, the chance of getting any card is always 1 / Total number of cards.

Today I played lor, I played LAB mode. A mode that fights with Ai with characters like Yasuo Jinx Jayce to choose from. I have played Yasuo until Victor. Before reaching the Viktor stage, I had to pass a level where it was random, every turret Round start.
I'm going to tell you that **** is so unbalanced I'm stuck at level 3 4 times and still haven't passed.
I think what
1. Unbalanced is a card that Ai randomly gets and still gets a Key word. Key word is this. It pisses me off a lot. I randomly hit through and the one that hit through is a T-Rex 8/8.
2. The card I have The gad I randomly picked up some important characters.
2.1 Cleared the whole board (this one I'm okay with) but what's not okay is when the main character is dead What character? to defeat the T-rex 8/8 Overwhelm.

2.2 Random Gards Gards that can make me play easier won't say. For example, if I do a Yasuo + Yone combo, these gards won't come out.

its simmilar to tft, but worse. TFT, but not that good. It is a card game .

The game is something between Meh and OK.
F2P friendly, nice Graphics/Artwork and regual new content makes it fun for a game now and then.

The biggest let down for me are Bugs, Metaplay and communication.
Bugs appear on a dayli base and range from grafics glitches into others to cards wont work or you cant place them (even though i encountered gamebreaking bugs very rarely).
Bugs stay in the game for very long until they get fixed e.g. Shurima came out 8 Months ago and Azirs voice lane is still cut during the lvl up animation.

Communication means, i have the feeling they only hear positiv feedback and ignore negativ feedback/player suggestions, one reason i post my critic here.
Imo the Report Side is not comfortable (i was not able to use it for a long time) and i dont like the big chatroom on discord, i feel ignored.

There are a lot builds you can play but only for the Memes, not for winning. In ranked, you can see only flavor of the month, the Metagame is very strong in this one.
Off-Meta builds are really not fun to play and the few Meta Builds change on every patch.
Power Creep is a huge problem in LoR, every patch, the new Cards are way more powerfull then the "older ones", either by having way better Stats/cost ratio or have the same stats but really good keywords.
The game makes no secret that it has its focus on fast games, thats why rush decks are Meta and lategame or control decks feel useless. E.g. Seamonsters needs you to throw 25 of your 40 cards away ,literally(!), to have theyr keyword work.
The only reason i do sometimes recommend it to some die hard League fans is its because its F2P.

EDIT: New expansion is out, tonns of skinns, new power creep no balancing.
Unbalanced, and don't know if the game is more luck than me but it always got a card to beat me just in time all the time, and the cards too op, then riot just add more op card, overall: almost trash

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a stunning masterpiece. Its painterly aesthetic feels alive, with animations that flow like brushstrokes in motion. The voice acting is exceptional, giving every moment emotional weight. But the real highlight is the innovative combat systemâ€”fluid, strategic, and refreshingly original. A rare blend of beauty and brilliance.
At first i thought that it was boring, but when I bought it and tried it Ifound out that it was an absolute masterpiece.
I created a metacritic account for the sole reason of giving this game the 10 it deserves.  Fantastic game.  Hits you in the feels.  Super pretty.

This is one of the greatest game of the last 15 years. Made with love and passion, a real team with real ideas that sets a new standard for the genre. the music is incredible, the arts are amazing and the narrative is movie-worthy. and for 50 euros? Makes you think about the 80 euros black ops 7 wants. Just play it, this is one of those rare 10/10 games

It's the best game i played in all my life (i'm over 30). The story is not only deep and touching but also twisted and unforeseeable (at least some elements).

The soundtrack is 11/10. I can not believe the composer was found on some obscure french forum by the CEO of sandfall. It's extremely impressively composed. In fact, i listen to it outside of the game for quite some time.

Graphics and animations are also very nice. Unfortunately, no native FSR4 support - but nothing OptiScaler can't fix.

I feel very lucky to be privileged to be able to be playing this game (currently 80+ hours in). It's a one-of-a-lifetime thing i think. Easily gamef the decade. I didn't even know i like JRPG turn-based, but this game opens your eyes and ruins every other game for you.

This game reminded me of the magical feeling when I first play Final Fantasy. It offers an experience you will only get once every 5 years or so. 
The art design breathe life into the world; everything looks amazing and stylish. 
The music fits perfectly with the scene and elevated the experience to a whole new level. Even listening by themselves, they are phenomenal track.
The story has the best hook in all of gaming and lots of unexpected twist and turn along the way. The story deals with serious theme but knowing when to add funny moment, there's never a tonal inconsistency throughout the gameplay. 
The addition of dodge and parry to the game, a simple addition, but combining with terrific boss animation, makes the combat experience very engaging and enjoyable.
Overall, a game you must experience in your lifetime.

Bought this game with the expectations of getting the masterpiece, the best game ever made, the true ultimate legend ****. Instead I got huuuge disappointment and wasted dozens of euros. I got a game with falsely described genre, a game with shallow characters, a game which is now a new king of running simulators, as there is literally nothing else to do, you just run, and then you fight, and then run again, and fight, and run, and fight, .... I was told it was great turn-based game with real-time mechanics, instead I got QTE game, but with control over up to 3 characters (so I did QTE in turns for them). Combat is also extremely unbalanced, as literally just parrying can win every single fight in this game, while missing a dodge or parry in later stages of the game means instant fail, team death and reset from last save. This is tied to abilities and perk-buy management. There are multiple distinct abilities (at least the text is different), however because of the lack of game balance I mentioned previously, it actually does not matter what abilities does player pick, as dodging or parrying perfectly is the only singular requirement to win every single fight in the entire game without any exceptions. Adding to that, this results in excesive repetitivness of gameplay. Next up, I was expecting bit of a roleplaying (that is this "RP" in RPG), but I got no dialogues at all while playing the game (except for the camp, there I was able to read few lines of dialogues, and except for cutscenes, obviously). Many praised this game for story, but somehow I got another cheap premise with rushed second half of the story. The idea was good though, just the execution was simply bad. Nonchalant "cute" cutscenes did not fit the narrative and were breaking the "immersion" for me, although immersion is veeeery strong word to use here, as this game does not deliver immersion of any kind. The same goes for OST, which was quite good, however some anime-like combat bangers absolutely did not fit the atmosphere at all. Last but not least I will mention the visuals, which are as good as in any UE5 game, so nothing special there, but nothing to complain about either, except for two things - 1) developers tried to make every environment special, unique and distinct, but the result is quite the opposite as all the locations feel simmilar in every way except for colours used in them; and 2) glitches were EVERYWHERE.

In conclusion, the hype around this game is as artificial as it gets, driven by "30 devs" story, which is also not true. This game has nothing much to offer for people with some standards. If you like empty corridors, endless running and QTE, this is a game for you. Objectively, if this was not advertised as "game of the generation" I would give this game like 4/10, however, I expected 100x more from advertised "masterpiece" and ended up deeply disappinted, like I probably never was before.

This was my first time playing a game with turn-based combat, and I was completely hooked. The amount of freedom is incredibleâ€”whatever you can imagine, you can actually do. It is easily one of the top 3 RPGs, if not the best, I've ever played.

To be frank I didn't enjoy it as much as other people did. Yes, it's very fun and deep game, yet it's just RPG that we had back in 2000. All critical acclaim comes from the fact that we don't have such games anymore.

I can see why Hades is so popular. I just canâ€™t seem to get into the game. There is too much chaos and button mashing for my liking. It just feels to chaotic.

Hades 2 is a very disappointing for such a highly anticipated sequel. The gameplay is still solid, but it feels too much familiar. The story moves too slowly, and the new features donâ€™t really change much. Some bosses feel frustrating rather than challenging. Too bad,  the first game set the bar so high.

Hades II looks great at first glance, but once you dive in, the cracks show. The combat is messy, progression feels sluggish, and the magic of the first game just isnâ€™t there. Itâ€™s not terrible, but itâ€™s nowhere near the masterpiece its predecessor was.

I loved the first Hades, but the sequel feels like a step back. The pacing is slow, fights are unbalanced and drag on with spongey enemies, and the new characters lack the charm of the original cast. Technically itâ€™s rough too, with performance drops and clunky controls. Instead of fresh ideas, it often feels like recycled content packaged as a new game.

Got it gifted to me after watching two of my friends froth out the mouth over it and uhhhhh it's fine. Sure, the graphics are really polished and the high speed gameplay is really engaging, but the music and voice lines are legitimately so annoying to me that I've just been playing with most of the audio muted. Not to mention, some of the enemies themselves often end up turning the combat into feeling more akin to something like Contra with the infuriating amount of bullets and attacks being thrown at you. Most of the actual gameplay itself is fine, but there's definitely more I dislike than enjoy.

this game is one of the worst roguelikes in terms of gameplay. It's literally Click-Click Dash. You just click on enemies from afar, and the game takes the worst aspects of combat in isometric games - the enemies are dumb, there are a lot of them, and they're so fat that you have to click on them for about 30 seconds. The gameplay is terrible, there's no depth, and there's nowhere to explore. The build system is the same - there's no variety or depth to the build - you choose one thing and focus on that for the entire run, because if you try to focus on multiple things, you won't have enough damage. It hurts me to see that many people consider this game to be one of the best roguelikes. It's not a bad game, but it's a shame for the genre as a roguelike. It's a roguelike for those who have never played a roguelike before.

review_text: This game is one of my favorites, and I have a collective time playing it of over 700 hours and still climbing. At first glance, it seems generic, even bad to some. Its graphics are still a bit rough, but even they are still improving with each update. It has an addicting gameplay loop and has a wonderful community backing it. It's a fun first person zombie survival game with base building and even some level of tower defense. It has a learning curve, but it's worth putting in the effort to get past it.

review_text: This game has been in development for more then 10 years and for the last several years those old, delusional devs made 7 Days To Die just worse. They didn't add any real new content, but just messed existing content, changing things and existing mechanics for no reason whatsoever. They also hate their player base with passion. The game is technical mess, graphics are bad, survival elements are mostly removed, and bright colored magic zombies killed all immersion.

review_text: The grindathon forever nature of the last few years of updates have really soured this game for me. Can't scavenge water anymore. You basically have to do those radiant quests to get anything in this game, otherwise the loot tables are set so low. If i wanted to do radiant quests unending, i'd buy a subscription to Fallout 76 Plus.

review_text: It sure have an overall suite of working game mechanics, so you can consider this game as "playable".
