Throughout history, there have been numerous moments where discoveries embody the "perfect formula" principle, whether it's fire, the wheel, electricity, Coca-Cola... All of these discoveries or inventions are inherently part of a continuum of refinement driven by civilization's evolving needs through time and space. For example, Chess was played thousands of years ago with unlimited time per move, each piece had very different movement rules and overall rules differed significantly from modern ****, the "perfect formula" of Chess itself remains unchanged and will likely endure as long as our cognitive 'modus operandi' remains as it is. To put it more illustratively, these "perfect formula" discoveries and objects resonate with us much like corners resonate with spiders or trees and rivers resonate with beavers. Our minds are wired to engage with these perfect circuits in all their brilliance, because the human mind is a brilliant invention of evolutionary processes and this engagement is simply enjoyable wallowing in our own **** such perfect circuit, among many others in different fields, is Dota 2. This game is flawless in its **** course, you would make a logical mistake in qualitatively comparing Chess with the wheel, or fire with Coca-Cola, or electricity with Dota 2, or even Chess with Dota 2 - which is usually the case. Each of these phenomena holds its own utility field, and their disparate, incommensurable states should be considered within their own contexts and frameworks. Chess and Dota 2 may have superficial similarities, but they are fundamentally different, like "original Cola" VS "DIY Fanta" different, the only similarity might be the carbonated bubbles in both drinks, which metaphorically could resemble your mental engagement through all aspects of being tricky, witty, or cunning in strategizing and anticipating moves of your opponent in Chess, or timing your spells in Dota 2 either alone or in synergy with your... ****, yes, THE TEAM. Damn. This sounds like it's always the same team and holy f, it actually is. The game has SO MANY players and has been out there for so long that it has crystallized a distinct pattern of mentality, which could literally be captured by the term "Team of Dota 2" with its own hypostatized face. The community in this game deserves special attention; it is a phenomenon that needs a separate review. Actually, it deserves a psycho-pathological study. It's no joke. It's unlike anything I've encountered in any online game before and I'm not using now personal experience (or lack thereof) as a validating instrument for this opinion - it's an objective fact, especially in recent times where its collective mind has reached its peak form.Anyway, back to the game, some surrounding aspects: I've seen many people discredit it, saying things like, "Damn, that game seems complex and time-consuming; I don't have the energy to invest in it." Yet they proceed to play Sudoku or Chess 24/7, others invest time in watching bare-bottom TV shows, some work and provide for their families, others gamble, others read books, etc... Everyone is occupied with something, but the 'rational' fear of this game persists, as if it's a virus that will devour their life like nothing else already does. This perception is completely distorted and based on faulty assumptions. As I said, the game is perfect in its core, and that "perfect formula" allows you to enjoy it endlessly...HOWEVER, THIS DOES NOT MEAN you should sacrifice your personality, abandon your character and dreams just to immerse yourself in this sinkhole. I mean, if you're confused about your priorities and lack essential personal values, that's your own weakness and fault. It's not the game's fault if you're inclined to start compensating for that weakness with a dominance-at-all-costs attitude in the game - initially just trying to win every match, and later becoming hyper-toxic towards others. Would you blame a beer company for your careless driving while drunk, or a casino for losing enormous amounts of money?

If you are already individually dissociated and dissolved into the crystallized Dota 2 mentality, of course you would. Noob.

Ah, Dota 2, that shining beacon of strategic perfection in the online gaming world, where each match is like a musical symphony of plans and tactics. Indeed, it is a game that immensely delights me, melting in the mouth like the culinary creation of a Michelin-starred chef. And the AI incorporated into it? Well, I must admit, its sophistication always astounds me when it pairs me and my "certainly" English-speaking teammates **** is quite astonishing that in this era of technological marvel, which Dota 2 undeniably represents, artificial intelligence has still not found a way to interpret the "Western Europe" and "English" filters so that the outcome matches these settings. As I nobly select these options, I expect to immerse myself in an English-speaking utopia, where each match becomes an oasis of British etiquette and Shakespearean exchange of courtesies. Instead, I often find myself as an unintended guest at a Cyrillic party, where communication is composed of mysterious runes and enigmatic pictograms.I cannot help but wonder if my client is inadvertently a window for the expansion of Russian influence, where every keyboard, regardless of chosen language preferences, is secretly programmed to convert everything into the letters of the Cyrillic alphabet. And I think to myself, oh, how charming, how insightful of Valve to provide me with cultural enrichment without my explicit consent. Indeed, how far can free education go?What an amazing school of patience and interpersonal skills, when this game guides me to mumble phrases in Russian that I've learned amidst the waves of "cyka blyat". Dota 2 is not just a game, but also a language course and a social experiment that broadens my horizons far beyond the usual limits. In its boundless kindness and education, Valve continuously contributes to my personal development. And for that, my endless gratitude.

Warframe is existing for over 12 years now. It has grown incredibly good. The game and its dev team had quite the journey in all this time and they did A LOT for their community. They are a PRIME example of how a dev team should approach the development of their game/product. Personally, I've never seen any game developer that poured so much heart and soul into his product, worked so well with everybody else and their community and did overall so incredibly much to stay alive.
Warframe offers: one of the friendliest communities in all of gaming, a deep, emotional lore, a huge variety of approaches for the gameplay itself, tons of missions, endless customizations, earnable in-game currency (you don't have to invest a single dime!), a huge variety of systems and content within the game.) and much more. And all that: FOR FREE!
It is an experience! 

Warframe is a big mile stone and a well kept secret.
Believe in the game and you won't be dissappointed.
Stay safe, Tenno.

After a certain point of progression in the game it almost seems like the content is endless. It certainly is a hidden gem for players who are just familiar with it. It does have some loose ends though, but pushing a through some time and learning it becomes a real reward.
Warframe lacks in beginner introduction to its game mechanics specifically being the upgrade system and where and how to acquire gear/items. It also lacks in early game story to flesh out the universe and onboard players into the world.
The microtransactions are completely avoidable as players can trade premium currency for in game items.

We could be looking at one of the best F2P in the history of video games. Warframe is a game that mixes fast-paced action action with the precision of a third-person shooter and a great parkour system.
Warframe offers a vast arsenal to suit all playstyles, with over 60 characters with their own unique identities and abilities and a versatile and intuitive build system.
This game will offer you months of fun and content, whether you're playing alone or with friends. And if you ever run out of content, don't worry, Warframe receives new content every few months, expanding its world and possibilities.

The current Warframe is unrecognizable from its version of 11 years ago, many reviews from the time don't do justice to the current state of the game, so don't be intimidated by the old reviews of professional critics.

The early platinum grind is not worth it; it makes the game hundreds of hours longer, and mainly, it is not fun.  If you think you can just go FREE and grind for everything, you WILL SUFFER . The new player experience is realy bad. If you are interested in this game, play it for a while, and then when you get your first 75% platinum discount, make a choice. Either buy 4k platinum with a 75% discount to remove the nonsensical and annoying time-wasting grind for absolute necessities like weapon and warframe slots OR decide that you don't want to make this one-time purchase and leave the game. If you are willing to BUY the starting platinum, it will carry you through the whole game, ONLY THEN you can truly enjoy the experience of progress in this game. Just go read all the other negative reviews; they are all about "hitting the wall" and "repetitive grind," which is all caused by the platinum grind that halts your progress; without it, the game is good; with it, you have to pay for the game to be good. Also, everything for real money (not platinum) is absurdly expensive. Everything is bundled up with stuff you do not want/need, like boosters, artificially making things expensiveâ€”for example, exclusive skins for 60â‚¬, etc. So if you are not rich, you won't get those even if you are grinding for platinum in-game. Lastly the company is woke, and the mods are ban happy. Don't even try to write anything negative or, god forbid, single slur to a griefer in your party; it WILL get you banned. So only play the game, and do NOT interact with anyone in the game; if you want to send a funny message to your friend, do it elsewhere and don't risk it. If you want to send a gift to your friend like platinum to start with, DONT, send them the money irl, otherwise, you will get banned. Basically, the whole community is made of snowflakes, and the company is trying hard to ponder to anyone and anything, so just play if you enjoy it, but don't talk to anyone, it's for your own good and the safety of your account.

EA has made many highly popular games including all FIFA games and PVZ games, including these games comes along Apex a popular battle royale game. Apex has many competitors which are generally any battle royale, however the main competitors it tends to be fighting is games like Fortnite, and call of duty. Apex has its difficulties, whilst having multiple game modes for players to play and enjoy, the game can get quite repetitive, and players can get bored or frustrated with the game over a period of time. Although the game is a multiplayer game so if you find some good friends to play with you can have endless fun. Apex is set on several mythical islands with one that is a giant ship flying high in the sky, and each island have lots of different POIs and lots of decorations such as huge creatures that look like dinosaurs and some players can even interact with and fight against to collect valuables in the game that will help the player later on in that game. The main aim of the game is to kill every other squad, trio, duo, or person and be the last remaining survivor and be pronounced the Apex champion, although to become a champion, the game has a skill-based matchmaking system, so based on your skill level of the game you will always get put against someone your skill level although sometimes it does have its faults, however there is always something new to learn such as new movement which can confuse your enemies however takes hours of practice to perfect. Apex is a battle royale based game so if you lose one match you can instantly go into a new one giving it constant replay ability and you can play until your hearts content. It is a somewhat modable game where you can access controls within the game files which allow you to set multiple movements to 1 key and set a timer for it which specifically helps in Apex as it helps players who are struggling with all the movement techniques do the with ease.                                                                                             Apex is a cross-platform game allowing players to play with friends on all sorts of game consoles, however apex is a mildly big game as it is 56g to install the base game which may cause problems for some players.                                                                                                Apex legends is a free to play game however some long-time players would argue that buying certain skins in the game would highly benefit the player, but the game is free however what comes with this is that apex can be a very aesthetically pleasing game if played on a powerful enough device and high enough graphics, otherwise the game may look extremely basic, and you may suffer performance issues.                                                                                                                          Apex has a large variety of soundtracks that each player can collect different soundtracks that add a sense of either intense music or fun exciting music, apex also has quite a stable game most of the time with few glitches but sometimes a player can get severely unlucky and run into many glitches or bugs with the game. And sometimes the server. In conclusion Apex is a fun multiplayer game with lots of different game modes for players to enjoy with a constantly changing game modes that will keep players engaged with the game.

Apex Legends is one of EAâ€™s most notable titles, a battle royale game that continues to captivate players around the world even after several seasons. Since its launch, the game has managed to maintain an impressive relevance, not looking its age, thanks to regular updates and the introduction of new content. One of the main reasons for Apex Legendsâ€™ continued success is its competitive and accessible development. The game is structured in a way that is friendly to new players, with a gentle learning curve that allows newcomers to quickly adapt to the gameâ€™s mechanics. At the same time, the game offers enough strategic depth to keep veteran players challenged and engaged, with a constantly evolving meta and a variety of characters, each with unique abilities. EA has managed to find an effective formula to keep players engaged season after season. The introduction of new characters, game modes, seasonal events, and map updates keep the gameplay experience fresh and exciting. This constant stream of new features and improvements keeps players coming back regularly, avoiding the stagnation that can plague other games in the genre. Despite its success, itâ€™s inevitable that some players have dropped out of the game over time. However, Apex Legendsâ€™ player base remains robust, with only a small portion of the original audience having left the game permanently. This is a testament to EAâ€™s ability to keep the game engaging and relevant, ensuring that the majority of players continue to find reasons to stick around and explore the dynamic world of Apex Legends.

Great Battle Royale game with high tension.

When the Battle Royale genre came to market, I played a couple of them. After PUBG, which I found fun for a while, but eventually bored me, Apex Legends hit the scene and it was an amazing experience.

In Apex Legends, you start in a team (with friends or random people) and choose a character and class. Each class has its own starting layout and proficiencies and, depending on the play style, can really make the difference between winning or losing.

An epic cutscene plays in which you are dropped from a plane, and while descending, you can choose where on the map to land. On your drop, you can also see the spread out other players, so you can determine somewhat how close they are going to be. After landing, you can explore a giant map in search of new weapons, enemies and gear.

Every so often, the playable area gets smaller and running into other players will be more likely by the minute. The tension is great and with each passing second, the chance for victory or annihilation gets closer. In the end, the combat arena is not bigger than a living room in a house and the combat en tension rises to a whole new level. It is them or you.

Apex Legends looks great. The huge map, the forests, the water, character models and color pallet, it is beautiful to look at. For me, the way the game looks, really enhanced my experience and made me choose this game over other Battle Royale games in the genre.

In terms of sound, the game is also outstanding. The glorious battle music at the start, the ambient, threatening tracks when exploring the map, it is just great.

The overall atmosphere of the game feels like a whole crowd of fans and supporters is watching. It has some sort of â€œSuper Bowl vibeâ€ if that makes sense. Sure, players who have been eliminated can watch you struggle (or die) but most move on to another game, which makes sense. Still, Apex Legends has this appeal.

I really liked the overall setting of the game. The action, the constant alertness of your surroundings, finding cool stuff, the adrenaline rush combat when you turn around a corner and the enemy is standing there, and one time, I even won the match with my team and I felt like a God.

The game is, of course, most fun to play with friends and the coordination and teamwork is just great. You are playing a video game, but it feels like you are in the army.

My only personal problem with Battle Royale games like this, is that you find a lot of cool stuff, get one-shotted in the head, and the game is over. This has nothing to do with the game, it is just how it is played, but I always get a little bumped out over building up something cool and strong, and then lose it all in a second.

Overall, I think Apex Legends is a great game and I would recommend it to everyone.

Si bien me llevo unos recuerdos muy divertidos con Apex no tiene sentido recomendarlo a un jugador casual o primerizo, ya que actualmente el nivel de habilidad es tan alto que en vez de divertirse van a terminar frustrados. Por suerte logre completar todos los logros de Steam antes de retirarme.

genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
review_text: Path of Exile is nothing short of a masterpiece in the action RPG genre, offering players an unparalleled experience that combines depth, complexity, and engagement. The game excels with its vast character customization options, particularly through the intricate passive skill tree and the unique skill gem system, allowing players to create truly personalized builds that cater to their playstyle. The dark, immersive world of Wraeclast is rich with lore and filled with challenging enemies and epic loot, making exploration feel rewarding and exhilarating. The frequent updates and expansions demonstrate the developers' commitment to constantly evolving the game, introducing new mechanics, leagues, and content that keep the community excited and engaged. Additionally, the gameâ€™s free-to-play model is executed flawlessly, offering a fair experience without pay-to-win elements, making it accessible for everyone. Overall, Path of Exile stands as a benchmark for what an online RPG can achieve, combining deep mechanics, a thriving community, and an expansive world into a consistently rewarding adventure that sets a high standard in the genre.

genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
review_text: The only downside of PoE is the barrier of entry for new players. Being such a complex game, with years of deep complex, and meaningful systems accumulated, the game can be quite intimidating for new players. But I can guarantee that if you like the genre and keep playing past the initial learning curve, you will not be disappointed. The character progression and build creation potential are honestly almost endless, and this paired with a solid campaign and an AMAZING (and almost a bit addictive) endgame array of options, makes this my all-time favourite game to play continuously.

genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
review_text: Iâ€™ve now played POE 2 for over 90 hours, and Iâ€™m completely disappointed. The only aspects that make the game remotely interesting are the graphics and the skill tree. The regular mobs on the maps are generally no challenge at all. Bosses simply spam countless AOE attacks and throw trash mobs at you. Thereâ€™s no noteworthy mechanic or significant challenge behind the boss fights. They just deal massive damage and have an endless health pool. When itâ€™s supposed to be â€œespecially difficult,â€ the boss room is artificially shrunk until youâ€™re forced to fight an AOE-spamming boss in a tiny square, or they use damage types against which itâ€™s nearly impossible to have sufficient **** 1 is far more entertaining and enjoyable to play. In this case, it feels like they tried to create a Dark Souls **** my opinion, POE 2 doesnâ€™t deserve any attention, and the price for early access to a free-to-play game is outrageous, especially since youâ€™re not really getting anything special for it. Sure, let the test players pay for the privilege of being test **** sum up POE 2 in bullet points:Boring mapsAbsurdly stupid boss fightsZero innovationExtremely long farming due to almost no useful gear dropsMindless grindAcceptable graphics but poor performanceThe game isnâ€™t worth a single cent! If youâ€™re considering buying it, I can only advise against it. Wait until itâ€™s free to play.

genres: Action, Adventure, Indie, Massively Multiplayer, RPG, Free To Play
review_text: POE fanboys will defend this shiny, polished turd to the death. Fact of the matter is this game is badly designed in so many ways, that GGG should strongly consider firing whoever came up with some of this. The skill tree is a disaster and needs to be completely reworked. Map bosses need fixed. Loot system needs fixed. Endgame needs a total overhaul. Endgame has no viable builds, you are gridlocked into one of the "templated" builds because experimentation does not work. Overall, these types of games are supposed to enforce risk and reward- this game has no reward. They tried to copy the dark souls formula and dropped the ball. POE fanboys will say "ph well i had no problem sinking 12 hours of my day into getting a weapon that does 4-12 more dmg than my current one" as if that's anything BUT bad game design. Skip this one.

review_text:
BAD - Lazy balancing and instant death boss fights.

Drop rates are insanely low and will drop gear for all classes which makes getting any upgrade for your class very hard to come by. The only way to progress is to stock pile items and switch classes when you have enough good items for the other classes because you won't be finding upgrades for the class that you are playing.

Level ups feel worthless as STR, DEX, INT no longer provide major stat improvements. Skills no longer level up. The only character they seem to have balanced the game around is the Warrior, ever other class dies so quickly it's not funny.

Performance wise the game stutters a lot and floats between 40-50 FPS with a 2080 on medium.

I'm so tired of devs labelling their game dank souls because they are too lazy to balance their game and then to top it off throwing in instant death attacks to further ruin the game.

There is no cool gear or skills that you will find while playing. The players that look amazing bought their skins. Your character will always look like you are wearing a bag of potatoes. 

Seriously this is not worth your time and it doesn't respect your time.

review_text:
I think people that like playing with excel as fun might enjoy this game immensely. But I genuinely have no idea why it appeals to anyone except that's it is "free". 

Problems:
The interface is clunky and uninviting.
The skill system allows for customization but needs guides to make anything formidable. (a problem with Diablo as well really)
The gameplay is absolutely terrible and not fun.  
Jumpy and terrible animations.
So many horrible types of currency. 
Non-existent documentation. 
Boring story (is there a story?). 

Overall, I had zero fun in this game and I tried it several times over the years. I can't imagine the same people will make POE 2 any better, but I'm dumb enough to try it for $30. Hell, at least they tried and made a game. What have I done with my life?

genres: Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, Strategy, Free To Play
Action, Adventure, Massively Multiplayer, Strategy, Free To Play
review_text:
It's an insult (especially in the age of Overwatch 2) to call this game a clone, especially if you're aware of the development cycle and timeline of both games. But I do feel that I have to mention that first, due to the image the game has and how much that oversimplification has harmed the game's reputation.

This game honestly feels infinitely more balanced than OW foundationally. OW forces you to play certain team comps, on certain maps, with each character usually having a single viable playstyle with little room to budge. Paladins offers tons of playstyles for each character through options like talents, in-game store abilities (think MOBAs, not actual cash stores), and even a loadout system using deckbuilding to sway your characters skills to your playstyle, optimizing exactly how you play.

Overwatch is such a frustrating experience because of how thin its meta is and how you're forced into certain playstyles and comps. If you don't follow them, you're going to get steamrolled. If you play support or tank and don't have reliable teammates, you're going to get steamrolled since you can't manage enough to defend yourself. Paladins gives you the option to play your role and hold your own when you need.

This game is not an Overwatch clone, it is better. You have options, you're not limited in how you can play characters, and while you probably aren't going to win without solid teamwork, you can at least have more freedom to sway the game in your direction and keep yourself alive by fighting back.

Also horses so it doesn't take 7 years to get to the objective, Zenyatta could certainly use one lmao

review_text:
The game looks good , at first glance. It looks like it has variety through the heroes with the card(spec trees) etc and you can actually get all the heroes or almost just by farming the game, you do not actually have to pay to win.
On the good side, the game has some nice ideas, the mount system is fun, the rounds are not long nor short(sometimes). The graphics are Ok-ish at best.(well, it is a free game).

The bad things : Server HUGE lags, game stuck at loading screens, people stuck in spawn not being able to move.
Too many afkers and bots (?)
Even worse things for a shooter : the hitboxes are ridiculous ,huge and misleading on many heroes.
Whole movement seems clunky and not solid at all, there is some slight input lag , it feels like its in the game.
It could be very good , but it needs money.
OW 2 is copying a lot of things from this, but better, because of the obvious budget differences.

review_text:
Not only is this game bland, unbalanced, pay-to-win and boring, it also ensemblifies everything that the average ""gamer"" does not want in the video-game industry, including (but not limited to):
*Blatant rip-off, garbage gameplay which shamelessly copies and pastes something that had its own success (not only a blatant Overwatch rip-off but it also announced its brand new Battle Royale gameplay when Forntnite and Pubg were having their boom)
*Treating video-games as if they were a banal product, look, I get some kind of capitalistic business practices if you're producing regular goods, but by riding into trends and trying to get money out of every single aspect of anything, at the point of making the game p2w, are practices that should be frowned upon and bashed within the video-game community, yet we accept pieces of **** like this game
*Mind-blowingly sexualized female characters without any purpose, lore-justification, or objective whatsoever

I think what annoys me the most about this game is the community approval it recieved, "games" like this should not exist, if we don't make this clear as a community **** like this will keep on being released and the market will overflow with nefarious products of this kind, the true decadence of the gaming industry.

Destiny 2 started off shaky, however the latest release (Witch Queen) provides much needed updates to various systems including revamping the old specs, and new weapon forging system. Legendary mode is a nice challenge solo or with friends. If you are on the fence, Iâ€™d say check it out you wont be sorry!

*Destiny 2* is a sequel that expands and refines the experience of the original game, taking players on an epic journey across the galaxy to save humanity. The main story is more cinematic and accessible, with a plot that sees the Guardians facing Dominus Ghaul and the Red Legion, an army threatening to destroy Earth and the Light of the Traveler. The campaign is well-structured, offering a clearer narrative arc than the original, with engaging cutscenes and memorable moments that enhance players' understanding of the *Destiny* **** gameplay in *Destiny 2* retains the series' signature fluidity and responsiveness, with precise shooting mechanics and unique abilities for each class. The three main classesâ€”Titan, Hunter, and Warlockâ€”return, each with new subclasses that bring variety and strategic options to combat. PvE content has expanded significantly, with missions, new explorable planets, and activities like Adventures and Lost Sectors that add depth to exploration. Raids remain a highlight of the endgame experience, featuring complex mechanics that demand strong player **** the PvP front, *Destiny 2* offers a wide range of modes, with a 4v4 structure that creates a tighter, more competitive pace. However, the initial progression system faced criticism for a lack of rewards and incentives, which Bungie has improved over time with updates and new expansions.Visually, *Destiny 2* is stunning, with breathtaking environments and rich artistic detail. Each planet has a unique and distinctive aesthetic, and the attention to visual details further elevates immersion. The soundtrack, featuring epic orchestral compositions, adds emotional depth to the gameâ€™s key **** essence, *Destiny 2* provides a visually and narratively richer experience, blending polished gameplay with expansive content, making it a standout continuation of the *Destiny* saga.

This is my favorite game. The best place to kill time. The game is more suitable for fans of endless farming. This is the twin brother in spirit of Warframe. Almost the same idea, but so different. I definitely recommend it to those who are familiar with Warframe

Destiny 2 is a game in a rather rough shape followin (date 12/11/2023) heavy layoffs and the posticipation of the final expansion (which lorewhise was meant to be like marvel's endgame in a place where its infinity war didnt deliver well).
playing this game on its fullest requires roughly an ammount of 180 euros if you want the full fleshed out experience, in a place where doing endgame activities requires a group of people (3 in total for dungeons, 6 for raids), thats rather hard to find in a community that on one side calls the experts elitists with massive egos and one the other views helping new players out a rather big waste of time.
Is destiny 2 worth playing? yes (on pc expecially) despite the downsides a new player has a lot to work with, improving, finding a team/clan and testing themselves on normal and hard versions of interesting raids and (for the more masochist) testing themselves in trials on a pvp ruled by meta ability spam of certain characters, exotics and damn smgs with qa rather **** balancing. (it aint worth it trust me). On a run for normal and adept loot with specific rolls.

Storywhise you have to put a lot of hope on how the story of the final shape expansion delivers, hoping that the season "battle pass" ceazes to exist with the following episodes that will be later introduces. the previous ones were mostly mediocre (apart from the witch queen).
Play this game (which possesses beautiful qualities) only if you ae aware of the risks...

I find the haters bitter, twisted & deluded.  I've been gaming for decades & Destiny is unmatched now and for the foreseeable future. As a shooter looter there isn't even a competitor in the ballpark.  Simple as that.  Haters gotta hate, if shooter looters aren't your genre then go back to Minecraft or Sim 3.
One word great game.  Don't judge something without paying it.  Fun and great game.

Destiny 2 is the best game I have played in years.  An MMO with a great single player campaign.  Customization out the ying yang.  Graphics are just incredible on my Nvidia 1060 3GB, believe it or not.  Runs perfectly and Bungie has created a masterpiece here.  I absolutely do not understand the hate for this game.  I have only 6 hours in and have barely scratched the beginning.  Controls are simple and no tutorial needed.  Get this game!
Complain about dlc's and prices while i just play the main game witch is largely enough.

The game doesn't work as a whole, and the Tapir error appears. At the same time, the content was not withdrawn on general grounds. The game is not working, the paid content is unavailable because the developers have decided to block the CIS region. In other words, they took the money, but restricted access to the content based on regional and national characteristics. I can't continue using the paid content or the game in general. Those who continue to play in other regions, think about it. The same thing may happen to you one day.

The focus isnâ€™t on creating a rich, engaging experience for players anymore, itâ€™s on squeezing every cent out of the community. Bungie has shown they donâ€™t value their playersâ€™ time, only their wallets.With Sonyâ€™s acquisition, thereâ€™s hope for changeâ€”but right now, Destiny 2 is running on a rinse-and-repeat formula that insults loyal players whoâ€™ve supported the game for years. Donâ€™t reward this behavior. Spend your money elsewhere until Bungie shows real respect for its community.

I went 2 hours without firing my gun a single time.
Bungie is actively blocking Destiny 2  to be playable on SteamDeck and Linux. Well, then Bungie, we are done, you won't get anything good from me.

Despite a rough launch that led to a divebomb of negative reviews just about that, there's plenty of other things that really make you hate it.  
THE FINAL SHAPE LACKS REAL CHARACTER.   The villain is just annoying to see or even hear any wierd ramblings from.  The amazingly beautiful visuals and gunplay are so contrasting to story and overpowered ability spam.   The final shape is a mediocre offbeat soap opera.  The final shape is lucky that no other game is trying a first person live service looter shooter.    

Honestly Zavala, Ikora, and ghost are relatively annoying.  Did you realize that the story mentions some great apocalypse, then the FINAL SHAPE FEELS NOTHING LIKE THAT.  The missions are tedious and have several "gotcha" moments.  A lot of time I feel like I'm just waiting for some dialogue or something to just play out.

The best parts of Destiny's past have been the speaker, Cayde, SavathÃ»n, and Ghaul.  All of the world and feeling of complete power that SavathÃ»n had in the Witch Queen is just gone since then.

The "end game" still boils down to making the same dozen exotics work.  The grind to get perfect gear and eggballs is aweful. The most recent "events" are all based on FOMO and are horrible to play.   I hardly know anyone who could put in the hundreds of hours to complete the 25 lost sectors or 50 runs of onslaught.  The dev team has completely lost touch with their player base.  

Who wants 2 hour long actitives like the recent raid.  It's great for streamers and aweful for friendship.  People get bored repeating fights in a room with wave after wave of stuff spawning in.  The main way to die is to not memorize where things spawn in for their gotcha kills.  

It's going to be the same thing as usual.  Bungie literally gives Destiny expansions and all current FOMO items to all their streamers to keep them streaming it.  This is public knowledge.  In contrast, I keep running into people with 30-100 clears of dungeons and raids without the exotics or main loot.   It's absolutely repetitive to the point that you hate it and has only double downed on that.

If you feel like it's worth a playthrough of the story and not getting the main items of value that it's probably worth getting it for you.  If you are lonely and have nothing going on in life, it's a great opportunity to stay that way and that may be for you.   The final shape really didn't capture a gaming experience and is really hoping that you buy it for nostalgia of what once was a game.
An enormously wasted opportunity from a game that had the potential to be one of the best of all time but once again got hamstrung by greed
a mega piece of junk. created with money-grabbing and fast food junk type of gameplay in mind.
This game is bad. There is absolutely nothing else to say about this sorry ****. This game is just bad.
Cheaters everywhere. And Bungie does close to nothing to solve the issue. Frequent problems with the connection to complete the experience. A shame.

Absolutely not the game for me personally.

I did not like Destiny 2. Although my reasons are entirely personal, I just could not get into it. I never liked service model games to start with, and Destiny 2 is no exception.

From the start, I could not care less about the main story of the game. There is a whole universe of lore, story, events, memorable characters etc., but for some reason, I could not give a flying ****. I created my character, finished the tutorial and already felt pointless and bored. Normally I would â€œeducateâ€ the reader of my reviews with a quick recap of the story or main goal, but in this case, I just cared too less.

I played some missions and quests but nothing felt like it mattered. I go to the location, kill stuff, complete the mission, earn my rewards and felt hollow inside afterwards. The thought of repeating this process until I grew to a certain level pained me, and when reaching level ten or so, I was done.

Graphicly, I think Destiny 2 is boring. It is blend, stale and flat. The worst environment with these graphics is the Central Hub location. Weapons and animations look well and polished enough, but the color pallet is just boring.

Sound wise, I think this is one of the worst I have played. Sound effects and music is so generic and dull, and distant enemies do almost not make any sound or grunts at all.

The controls and menus were horrendous and really hard to figure out and understand for me, and the sleek, SQL database design of it did not appeal to me.

Loot was absolutely pointless in my opinion. You get the same weapon or armor twenty million times, but with a different rarity or color. The stats meant nothing to me and I had no freaking clue wat was good and wat was bad. The numbers showed me that an item was way better than the previous one, but when equipping it, I did not notice any difference.

Destiny 2 has a certain â€œtheme/skin/feelâ€ that is the same as games like Anthem or Starfield (in hindsight). It is hard to explain, but revolves about the look of the inventory screens, stat screens, quest markers, etc. It is purely based on the menus and inventory management. For me, that was a problem, because Anthem was one of the worst games I ever played in terms of boredom.

The feeling of a freemium game in which you complete generic missions over and over and over again is just not for me. I constantly got the feeling that I could achieve nothing, unless I pulled out my wallet, although this is technically not the case.

Because the game is â€œFreemiumâ€, you constantly get confronted with â€œdealsâ€, â€œspecial offersâ€, â€œnew store itemsâ€, and â€œbest valuesâ€ from the in game store. In the menuâ€™s, at the start screen, at every interactable screen, it just felt like playing a online webstore in a browser. I understand it, because of its model, but I just donâ€™t like microtransactions in games in general and, in hindsight, it is just better for me not to play this kind of games at all.

In conclusion, my own personal experience with Destiny 2 was very miserable. I hated every second of it and was bored out of my mind the second I even started the tutorial.

I personally would not recommend this game.

Not worth your time and money, only reused ****.
it was once a good game, now its just the shell of a company, dying and trying to not go down with out a big profit. STAY FAR AWAY FROM IT
